fields.name: Flaky Pie Dough Shell
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flaky-pie-dough': ['Flaky Pie Dough', '2, 10 lb', 'flaky-pie-dough']}
fields.directions: SHAPING CRUSTS  Crusts are shaped by rolling out the dough to fit into a pie pan or tart shell (mold) or to sit on top of fillings. Mealy, flaky and sweet doughs are all easier to roll out and work with if well chilled, as chilling keeps the fat firm and prevents stickiness. When rolling and shaping the dough, work on a clean, flat surface (wood or marble is best). Lightly dust the work surface, rolling pin and dough with pastry flour before starting to roll the dough. Also, work only with a manageable amount at a time: usually one crusts worth for a pie or standard-sized tart or enough for 10 to 12 tartlet shells.

fields.name: Mole
fields.ingredient_amount: {'tomatoes-plum': ['plum tomatoes', '4 ea', 'tomatoes-plum'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oilas needed', '', 'oil-olive'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '4 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'pepper-guajillo-chile': ['guajillo chile pepper', '2 ea', 'pepper-guajillo-chile'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'oregano-dried-whole': ['dried whole oregano', '1 tsp', 'oregano-dried-whole'], 'cinnamon-stick': ['cinnamon stick', '1 ea', 'cinnamon-stick'], 'cumin-whole': ['whole cumin', '1 tsp', 'cumin-whole'], 'chocolate-semisweet': ['semisweet chocolate', '2 oz', 'chocolate-semisweet'], 'sesame-seeds': ['sesame seeds', '4 oz', 'sesame-seeds'], 'onion': ['onion', '1 ea', 'onion'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '1 qt', 'chicken-stock'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1 sprig', 'thyme-fresh'], 'pumpkin-seeds': ['pumpkin seeds', '6 oz', 'pumpkin-seeds'], 'pepper-pasilla-chile': ['pasilla chile pepper', '2 ea', 'pepper-pasilla-chile'], 'allspice-ground': ['ground allspice', '1/2 tsp', 'allspice-ground']}
fields.directions: Grind the cinnamon and allspice in a spice grinder. Stem and seed the guajillo and pasilla chiles. Break them into small pieces and simmer them in water for 15 minutes. Drain well. Combine the sesame seeds, pumpkin seeds and cumin seeds and fry them in a dry saut pan until well toasted. Slice the onion approximately 1/2 inch (1.2 centimeters) thick. Brush the slices with oil and grill until well colored. Roast the tomatoes over the open flame of a gas burner until they are evenly charred and blis-tered. Remove the cores, peel the tomatoes and chop them coarsely. Combine the cinnamon and allspice with the chiles, toasted seeds, onion, tomatoes, garlic, thyme, oregano and stock in a saucepan. Season with salt and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat, cool and remove the sprig of thyme. Blend the mixture in a blender until smooth. Strain through a china cap and stir in the choco-late until melted. Adjust the seasonings. Serve the mole over grilled chicken, turkey, duck, quail or a meat such as pork or rabbit. Or, reheat cooked turkey or chicken pieces in the sauce until hot and serve with a portion of the sauce.

fields.name: Classic Dacquoise
fields.ingredient_amount: {'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '6 oz', 'sugar-granulated'], 'egg-whites': ['egg whites', '3 oz', 'egg-whites'], 'almonds-whole-blanched': ['whole blanched almonds', '2 oz', 'almonds-whole-blanched']}
fields.directions: Preheat oven to 225F (110C). Line a baking sheet with parchment. Draw three 8-inch (20-centimeter) circles on the parchment. Grind the almonds in a food processor. They should be the consistency of cornmeal and as dry as possible. Combine with 2 ounces (60 grams) sugar and set aside. Whip the egg whites on medium speed until foamy. Increase the speed and gradually add 1 ounce (30 grams) sugar. Continue whipping until the egg whites form soft peaks. Gradually add the remaining sugar. Continue whipping until smooth and glossy, approximately 2 minutes. Sprinkle the almond-sugar mixture over the meringue and fold together by hand. Using a pastry bag with a plain tip, pipe the meringue onto the parchment paper to form three 8-inch (20-centimeter) rounds. Bake until firm and crisp but not brown, approximately 60 to 75 minutes. Cool completely.

fields.name: Apricot Filling
fields.ingredient_amount: {'orange-juice-fresh': ['Orange Juice (fresh)', '1 pt', 'orange-juice-fresh'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '6 oz', 'sugar-granulated'], 'apricots-dried': ['dried apricots', '8 oz', 'apricots-dried'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '2 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'salt': ['salt', '0.05 oz', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Place the apricots and orange juice in a small saucepan. Cover and simmer until the apricots are very tender, approximately 25 minutes. Stir in the sugar and salt. When the sugar is dissolved, add the butter and remove from the heat.  Pure the mixture in a blender until smooth. Cool completely before using.

fields.name: Veal Scallops (6 oz)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'veal-top-round': ['veal top round', '6 lb', 'veal-top-round']}
fields.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim veal of all sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 6 oz. scallops. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.

fields.name: Basic Vinaigrette Dressing
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'salt': ['salt', '2 tsp', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '24 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'vinegar-wine': ['wine vinegar', '8 fl oz', 'vinegar-wine']}
fields.directions: Combine the vinegar, salt and pepper and mix well. Whisk in the oil gradually. Store at room temperature. VARIATIONS: Dijon VinaigretteAdd 4 ounces (120 grams) Dijon-style mustard to the vinegar and proceed with the recipe. Herb VinaigretteAdd 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) fresh herbs or 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) dried herbs such as basil, tarragon, thyme, marjoram and chives to the vinaigrette.

fields.name: Court Bouillon
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '1, 8 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'water': ['water', '1 gal', 'water'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '4 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '2 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'vinegar-white': ['white vinegar', '6 fl oz', 'vinegar-white'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '1 bunch', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1 pinch', 'thyme-dried-whole']}
fields.directions: Combine all ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes. Strain and use immediately or cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: Vichyssoise (Cold Potato-Leek Soup)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'leeks': ['leeks', '2 lb', 'leeks'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '24 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'potato-sweet': ['sweet potatoas needed', '', 'potato-sweet'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '3 1/2 qt', 'chicken-stock'], 'butter': ['butter', '8 oz', 'butter'], 'chives-fresh': ['fresh chivesas needed', '', 'chives-fresh'], 'potato-russet': ['russet potato', '2 lb', 'potato-russet'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Split the leeks lengthwise and wash well to remove all sand and grit. Slice them thinly. Sweat the leeks in the butter without browning them. Add the diced potatoes and stock, season with salt and white pepper and bring to a simmer. Simmer until the leeks and potatoes are very tender, approximately 45 minutes. Pure the soup in a food processor, blender or food mill; strain through a fine sieve. Chill the soup well. At service time, incorporate the cream and adjust the seasonings. Serve in chilled bowls, gar-nished with snipped chives and sweet potato frizzles.

fields.name: Balsamic Mustard Vinaigrette
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vinegar-balsamic': ['balsamic vinegar', '2 tbl', 'vinegar-balsamic'], 'oil-extra-virgin-olive': ['extra virgin olive oil', '4 tbl', 'oil-extra-virgin-olive'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '2 tsp', 'shallot'], 'oil-canola': ['canola oil', '4 tbl', 'oil-canola'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustard', '2 tsp', 'mustard-dijon'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: 1 In a stainless steel bowl, whisk together the vinegar, mustard, shallots, salt and pepper. 2 Combine the oils. Slowly whisk them into the vinegar-and-mustard mixture to form an emul-sified dressing.

fields.name: Goat Cheese and Potato Custard
fields.ingredient_amount: {'nutmeg-ground': ['ground nutmeg to taste', '', 'nutmeg-ground'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '6 ea', 'eggs'], 'butter': ['butter', '1 oz', 'butter'], 'chives-fresh': ['fresh chives', '2 tbl', 'chives-fresh'], 'cheese-goat': ['goat cheese', '4 oz', 'cheese-goat'], 'milk': ['milk', '4 fl oz', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'potato-russet': ['russet potato', '2 ea', 'potato-russet']}
fields.directions: 1 Melt the butter and toss the diced potatoes in the butter. Spread the potatoes on a sheet pan, season with salt and white pepper and roast at 375F (190C) until tender, approximately 25 minutes. 2 Whisk together the eggs and milk. Season the mixture with salt, white pepper and a little nutmeg. 3 Crumble the goat cheese over the potatoes and sprinkle with the chives. Divide the potato mixture among eight buttered, 4-fluid-ounce (120-milliliter) souffl dishes. Divide the cus-tard among the souffl dishes. Bake the custards at 300F (150C) until set, approximately 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and hold for service.

fields.name: Smoked Corn Pudding
fields.ingredient_amount: {'onion': ['onion', '3 tbl', 'onion'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt to taste', '', 'salt-kosher'], 'corn-fresh': ['fresh corn', '2 ea', 'corn-fresh'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '3 ea', 'eggs'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '1 1/2 oz', 'butter'], 'milk': ['milk', '1 pt', 'milk'], 'cornmeal-yellow': ['yellow cornmeal', '3 oz', 'cornmeal-yellow']}
fields.directions: 1 Coat an 8-inch- (20-centimeter-) square pan with 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) butter. 2 In a medium saucepan, bring the milk to a boil. Lower the heat and gradually whisk in the cornmeal. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes, stirring with a wooden spoon. 3 Add the salt, pepper, corn, onion and remaining butter; cook for an additional 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the egg yolks one at a time, beating well with a wooden spoon after each addition. 4 Add a pinch of salt to the egg whites and beat with a fine whisk until stiff. Fold the whipped egg whites into the cornmeal mixture, one half at a time. Pour into the buttered pan and bake at 350F (180C) until golden brown, approximately 30 minutes.

fields.name: Bordelaise Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'beef-marrow': ['beef marrowas needed', '', 'beef-marrow'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'demi-glace': ['Demi-Glace', '1 qt', 'demi-glace'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1 sprig', 'thyme-fresh'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '2 oz', 'butter'], 'wine-dry-red': ['dry red wine', '16 fl oz', 'wine-dry-red'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '2 oz', 'shallot']}
fields.directions: Combine 16 fluid ounces (480 milliliters) dry red wine, 2 ounces (60 grams) chopped shallots, 1 bay leaf, 1 sprig thyme and 1 pinch black pepper in a saucepan. Reduce by three-fourths, then add demi-glace and simmer for 15 minutes. Strain through a fine chinois. Finish with 2 ounces (60 grams) whole butter and garnish with sliced, poached beef marrow. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Ice Cream Base
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vanilla-bean': ['vanilla bean', '1 ea', 'vanilla-bean'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 pt', 'cream-heavy'], 'milk': ['milk', '1 1/2 qt', 'milk'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '16 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '20 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Combine the milk and cream in a heavy saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the vanilla bean (if using). Whisk the egg yolks and sugar together in a mixing bowl. Temper the eggs with one-third of the hot milk. Return the egg mixture to the saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the custard reaches 180F to 185F (82C to 85C). Pour through a fine mesh strainer into a clean bowl. Chill the cooked ice cream base in an ice bath, then refrigerate overnight before processing. VARIATIONS: Chocolate Ice CreamAdd approximately 9 ounces (270 grams) finely chopped bittersweet chocolate per quart (liter) of ice cream base. Add the chocolate to the hot mixture after it has been strained. Stir until completely melted. Cappuccino Ice CreamSteep the hot milk and cream with the vanilla bean and 2 or 3 cinnamon sticks. After the ice cream base is made, stir in 11 1/2 fluid ounces (3045 milliliters) coffee ex-tract. Brandied Cherry Ice CreamDrain the liquid from one 16-ounce (500-gram) can tart, pitted cherries. Soak the cherries in 1 1/2 fluid ounces (45 milliliters) brandy. Reduce the sugar to 16 ounces (480 grams) and prepare the ice cream base as directed, omitting the vanilla bean. Add the brandy-soaked cherries to the cooled custard before processing.

fields.name: Puff Pastry
fields.ingredient_amount: {'water': ['water', '7 fl oz', 'water'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '10 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 1/2 tsp', 'salt'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '13 oz', 'flour-all-purpose']}
fields.directions: To form the dtrempe, sift the flour and salt together in a large bowl. Cut the cold butter into small pieces and then cut the pieces into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse cornmeal. Make a well in the center of the mixture and add all the water at once. Using a rubber spatula or your fingers, gradually draw the flour into the water. Mix until all the flour is incorporated. Do not knead. The dtrempe should be sticky and shaggy-looking. Turn the dtrempe out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead the dough a few times by hand, rounding it into a ball. Wrap the dough tightly in plastic and chill overnight. To roll in the butter, first prepare the softened butter by placing it between two sheets of plas-tic wrap. Use a rolling pin to roll the softened butter into a rectangle, approximately 5 inches  8 inches (12.5 centimeters  20 centimeters). It is important that the dtrempe and butter be of almost equal consistency. If necessary, allow the dtrempe to sit at room temperature to soften or chill the butter briefly to harden. On a lightly floured board, roll the dtrempe into a rectangle approximately 12 inches  15 inches (30 centimeters  37.5 centimeters). Lift and rotate the dough as necessary to prevent sticking. Use a dry pastry brush to brush away any flour from the doughs surface. Loose flour can cause gray streaks and can prevent the puff pastry from rising properly when baked. Peel one piece of plastic wrap from the butter. Position the butter in the center of the rectan-gle and remove the remaining plastic. Fold the four edges of the dtrempe over the butter, en-closing it completely. Stretch the dough if necessary; it is important that none of the butter be exposed. With the folded side facing up, press the dough several times with a rolling pin. Use a rock-ing motion to create ridges in the dough. Place the rolling pin in each ridge and slowly roll back and forth to widen the ridge. Repeat until all the ridges are doubled in size. Using the ridges as a starting point, roll the dough out into a smooth, even rectangle approx-imately 8 inches  24 inches (20 centimeters  60 centimeters). Be careful to keep the corners of the dough as right angles. 10. Use a dry pastry brush to remove any loose flour from the doughs surface. Fold the dough in thirds, like a business letter. If one end is damaged or in worse condition, fold it in first; oth-erwise, start at the bottom. This completes the first turn. 11. Rotate the block of dough 90 degrees so that the folded edge is on your left and the dough faces you like a book. Roll out the dough again, repeating the ridging technique. Once again, the dough should be in a smooth, even rectangle of approximately 8 inches  24 inches (20 centimeters  60 centimeters). 12. Fold the dough in thirds again, completing the second turn. Cover the dough with plastic wrap and chill for at least 30 minutes. 13. Repeat the rolling and folding technique until the dough has had a total of five turns. Do not perform more than two turns without a resting and chilling period. Cover the dough com-pletely and chill overnight before shaping and baking.

fields.name: Dark Chocolate Glaze
fields.ingredient_amount: {'simple-syrup': ['Simple Syrup', '14 fl oz', 'simple-syrup'], 'milk-evaporated': ['evaporated milk', '14 fl oz', 'milk-evaporated'], 'pa-te-a-glacer': ['pÃ¢te a glacer', '17 oz', 'pa-te-a-glacer'], 'glucose': ['glucose', '3 oz', 'glucose'], 'chocolate-extra-bitter': ['extra bitter chocolate', '17 oz', 'chocolate-extra-bitter']}
fields.directions: 1 Bring the milk, glucose and syrup to a boil, stirring carefully. Do not whisk vigorously or you will incorporate too much air. 2 In a bowl, combine the dark chocolate coating or pte  glacer and the bittersweet chocolate. 3 Slowly pour the milk mixture onto the chocolate. Let it sit for approximately a minute. Using a whisk, stir the mixture slowly to incorporate the chocolate and milk. 4 Keep the mixture refrigerated. When ready to use, warm it over a water bath to 100F (38C). If the temperature gets any hotter the glaze will not be as shiny.

fields.name: Roast Veal Loin
fields.ingredient_amount: {'onion': ['onion', '2 ea', 'onion'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '3 sprig', 'thyme-fresh'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '4 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'jus-lia': ['Jus LiÃ©', '1 pt', 'jus-lia'], 'veal-loin-boneless': ['boneless veal loin', '3 lb', 'veal-loin-boneless'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'carrot': ['carrot', '2 ea', 'carrot']}
fields.directions: Tie the veal loin roast with butchers twine. Season the meat with salt and pepper and place it in a roasting pan. Scatter the onions, car-rots, garlic, thyme and bay leaves around it. Roast at 425F (220C) for approximately 45 minutes. Remove the meat from the roasting pan and cut away the twine. Hold in a warm place for service. Deglaze the roasting pan with the jus li. Strain the vegetables and liquid through a chinois into a small saucepan. Discard the solids. Bring the sauce to a boil and skim as much fat as possible from the surface. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon a portion of the sauce over the veal; serve the remainder on the side. Serve with any vegetable garnish such as cooked beets and beans with vinaigrette dressing.

fields.name: Rsti Potatoes
fields.ingredient_amount: {'potato-white': ['white potato', '4 lb', 'potato-white'], 'bacon-fat-from-production': ['bacon fat [from production]', '2 oz', 'bacon-fat-from-production'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt to taste', '', 'salt-kosher'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '1 oz', 'butter'], 'lard': ['lard', '2 oz', 'lard']}
fields.directions: Partially cook the potatoes in salted water until almost done. Drain and cool the potatoes, then peel and coarsely grate them. Heat the bacon fat and lard in a heavy, shallow 10-inch (25-centimeter) skillet with sloping sides until quite hot. Spread half the potatoes over the bottom of the pan; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover with the remaining potatoes and cook over medium-high heat until the bottom turns brown and crusty, approximately 10 minutes. Turn the potatoes in one piece. This is easiest to do by placing a large plate over the pan and turning both together so that the potatoes fall onto the plate. Slip the turned-over potatoes off the plate back into the pan, browned side up. Cook until the bottom is browned. Before serving, smooth the edges of the potatoes with a spatula. Sprinkle with salt and brush the edge of the pan with whole butter. It will melt and run into the potatoes. VARIATION: Cheddar Cheese Rsti PotatoesMake two thin cakes from the coarsely grated potatoes. Top one with a layer of 7 ounces (210 grams) sour cream, 2 ounces (60 grams) cubed sharp Cheddar cheese and 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) chopped chives. Top with the other cake. Dot with 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) whole butter and bake in a 400F (200C) oven for 15 minutes.

fields.name: Cream Cheese Filling
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '0.5 fl oz', 'vanilla-extract'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '4 oz', 'sugar-granulated'], 'flour-pastry': ['pastry flour', '3 oz', 'flour-pastry'], 'cheese-cream': ['cream cheese', '1, 8 lb', 'cheese-cream'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '4.8 oz', 'eggs'], 'lemon-zest': ['Lemon Zest', '0.07 oz', 'lemon-zest']}
fields.directions: MISE EN PLACE  Grate the lemon zest.  In the bowl of a mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, blend the cream cheese and sugar on low speed until smooth. Scrape down the bowl and gradually add the eggs, scraping the bowl between each addition.  Stir in the vanilla and lemon zest. Fold in the flour.  Fill pastries with this mixture before baking.

fields.name: Minted Cheese Mousse
fields.ingredient_amount: {'water': ['water', '2 fl oz', 'water'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '10 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'cheese-mascarpone': ['mascarpone cheese', '10 oz', 'cheese-mascarpone'], 'mint-compound': ['mint compound', '1/2 fl oz', 'mint-compound'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '4 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: 1 Cut the cream cheese or mascarpone into medium cubes, place in a bowl and soften in a mi-crowave oven until the cheese is 90F (32C). 2 Boil the water and sugar for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and cool, then use a spatula to incorporate into the softened cheese. 3 Whip the mint compound and heavy cream to soft peaks. (Or cut the mint leaves into a fine chiffonade, add to the heavy cream and whip to soft peaks.) Fold the cream into the cheese mixture and use immediately.

fields.name: Shirred Eggs with Ham
fields.ingredient_amount: {'ham': ['ham', '1/2 oz', 'ham'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 tbl', 'cream-heavy'], 'cheese-swiss': ['Swiss cheese', '1 tbl', 'cheese-swiss'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '2 ea', 'eggs'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butteras needed', '', 'butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Brush the interior of a 6-fluid-ounce (180-milliliter) ramekin with melted butter. Line the ramekin with the ham. Break the eggs into a cup and pour them carefully into the ramekin on top of the ham. Season with salt and pepper. Bake at 325F (160C) until the eggs begin to set, approximately 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from the oven, then add the cream and cheese. Return to the oven until the eggs are cooked and the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

fields.name: Hugo's Meatballs
fields.ingredient_amount: {'beef-ground': ['ground beef', '5 lb', 'beef-ground'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '3 ea', 'eggs'], 'onion-powder': ['onion powder', '2 tbl', 'onion-powder'], 'cheese-parmesan': ['parmesan cheese', '2 1/2 oz', 'cheese-parmesan'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1 1/2 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '3 oz', 'parsley-fresh'], 'worcestershire-sauce': ['worcestershire sauce', '1 fl oz', 'worcestershire-sauce'], 'bread-crumbs-dried': ['dried bread crumbs', '4 1/2 oz', 'bread-crumbs-dried'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt'], 'oregano-dried-whole': ['dried whole oregano', '2 tbl', 'oregano-dried-whole'], 'garlic-powder': ['garlic powder', '2 tbl', 'garlic-powder']}
fields.directions: Combine all ingredients and mix lightly. Using a #16 portion scoop, divide into 2-ounce (60-gram) meatballs and round evenly. Place the meatballs on sheet pans and bake at 325F (160C) until they are just set, not browned, approximately 20 minutes. Drain the grease from the pan. Remove the meatballs with a slotted spoon and carefully drop into tomato sauce. Simmer for 20 minutes to allow the meatballs to finish cooking and to blend the flavors. Serve the meatballs and sauce with pasta or as desired.

fields.name: Wild Mushroom and Veal Soup
fields.ingredient_amount: {'brown-veal-stock': ['Brown Veal Stock', '24 fl oz', 'brown-veal-stock'], 'mushrooms-shiitake': ['shiitake mushrooms', '4 oz', 'mushrooms-shiitake'], 'french-bread-croutons': ['French Bread Croutonsas needed', '', 'french-bread-croutons'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '2 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '2 tsp', 'garlic'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsleyas needed', '', 'parsley-fresh'], 'mint-fresh': ['fresh mint', '4 tbl', 'mint-fresh'], 'mushrooms-oyster': ['oyster mushrooms', '4 oz', 'mushrooms-oyster'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Briefly saut the garlic in the oil. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender and any liquid given off has evaporated. Add the stock, minced parsley and mint; simmer for 15 minutes. Season  to taste. Place one crouton in each soup bowl. Ladle in the soup and garnish with the finely chopped parsley.

fields.name: Raspberry Ganache
fields.ingredient_amount: {'raspberry-puree': ['raspberry puree', '10 fl oz', 'raspberry-puree'], 'chocolate-semisweet': ['semisweet chocolate', '9 oz', 'chocolate-semisweet'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '2 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'pectin': ['pectin', '1/2 tsp', 'pectin'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1 1/2 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: 1 Chop the chocolate into pea-size bits, place in a bowl and set aside. 2 Heat the raspberry pure to 120F (49C) in a nonreactive pan. 3 Thoroughly mix the pectin and sugar. Whisk it into the raspberry pure and bring to a boil. 4 Pour approximately 2 fluid ounces (60 milliliters) of the hot pure into the bowl of chocolate. Combine with a spatula, adding the remaining pure in four increments. 5 Stir in the butter. If lumps form or if the chocolate fails to melt completely, place the bowl over a bain marie until completely melted and smooth. Use immediately.

fields.name: Chteaubriand Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'wine-dry-white': ['dry white wine', '16 fl oz', 'wine-dry-white'], 'demi-glace': ['Demi-Glace', '1 qt', 'demi-glace'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '2 oz', 'shallot'], 'butter': ['butter', '4 oz', 'butter'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh) to taste', '', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'tarragon-fresh': ['fresh tarragonas needed', '', 'tarragon-fresh'], 'pepper-cayenne': ['cayenne pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-cayenne']}
fields.directions: Combine 16 fluid ounces (480 milliliters) dry white wine and 2 ounces (60 grams) diced shallots. Reduce the mixture by two-thirds. Add demi-glace and reduce by half. Season  to taste with lemon juice and cayenne pepper. Do not strain. Swirl in 4 ounces (120 grams) whole butter to finish and garnish with chopped fresh tarragon. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Orange Segments
fields.ingredient_amount: {'oranges': ['oranges', '1 ea', 'oranges']}
fields.directions: Wash and dry orange. Using sharp paring knife, cut off the outer peel and white pith. Cutting between the membranes, cut clean orange segments (supremes).

fields.name: Filet of Beef with Coffee Beans
fields.ingredient_amount: {'beef-tenderloin': ['beef tenderloin', '2, 8 lb', 'beef-tenderloin'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt', '1 tsp', 'salt-kosher'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '2 tbl', 'oil-olive'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '6 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'tortilla-corn': ['corn tortilla', '3/4 oz', 'tortilla-corn'], 'coffee-beans': ['coffee beans', '2 tbl', 'coffee-beans'], 'cocoa-powder': ['cocoa powder', '1 tbl', 'cocoa-powder'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '2 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'cinnamon-ground': ['ground cinnamon', '1/8 tsp', 'cinnamon-ground'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '20 fl oz', 'chicken-stock'], 'onion-white': ['white onion', '8 oz', 'onion-white'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '1/2 oz', 'butter'], 'pepper-pasilla-chile': ['pasilla chile pepper', '1/2 oz', 'pepper-pasilla-chile'], 'sugar-light-brown': ['light brown sugar', '1 tsp', 'sugar-light-brown'], 'grits': ['gritsas needed', '', 'grits']}
fields.directions: Trim the beef tenderloin, removing all silverskin. Cut a 2- to 2-pound-8-ounce (0.9- to 1.2-kilogram) piece from the large (butt) end of the tenderloin. Tie this filet with butchers twine at 12-inch (1.2-centimeter) intervals. Rub the filet with salt and pepper, then rub it with the oil. Stir together the coffee, cocoa powder and cinnamon. Spread the mixture on a work surface and roll the filet in it in order to coat the beef evenly. Allow the beef to marinate for approx-imately 30 minutes. To prepare the pasilla chile broth, heat a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the butter and saut the onions and garlic until browned. Add the pasilla chiles and tortilla pieces and saut until golden brown. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover loosely and cook for 10 mi-nutes. Remove from the heat and cool. Pure the sauce in a blender until smooth and strain through a china cap. Add the cream, salt and brown sugar and stir to combine. The sauce should not be very thick; thin it with additional stock or water if necessary. Hold for service. Place the filet on a rack in a roasting pan. Roast the filet at 400F (200C) for 10 minutes. Lower the heat to 250F (120C) and cook the beef to the desired doneness, approximately 20 minutes for medium rare. Remove from the oven, remove the twine and allow to rest be-fore carving. Slice the filet to the desired thickness and serve one thick slice or several thin slices fanned on each plate. Serve with grits, polenta or mashed potatoes.

fields.name: Persillade
fields.ingredient_amount: {'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '3 oz', 'parsley-fresh'], 'fresh-bread-crumbs': ['Fresh Bread Crumbs', '6 oz', 'fresh-bread-crumbs'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 oz', 'garlic'], 'butter': ['butter', '6 oz', 'butter']}
fields.directions: Combine the garlic, parsley and bread crumbs. Drizzle the butter over the mixture and toss to blend. Sprinkle the persillade over cooked meats or vegetables as a topping, then place the dish un-der a broiler until lightly browned.

fields.name: Duck Confit
fields.ingredient_amount: {'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '4 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pepper-cracked-black': ['cracked black pepper', '1 tsp', 'pepper-cracked-black'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '6 sprig', 'thyme-fresh'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '6 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'duck-fat': ['duck fat', '2 lb', 'duck-fat'], 'duck-whole-4-5-lb': ['whole 4-5 lb duck', '1 ea', 'duck-whole-4-5-lb'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt', '2 tbl', 'salt-kosher']}
fields.directions: Rub the duck with the salt. Place it skin side down in a roasting pan just large enough to hold the pieces in one layer; season with the pepper, bay leaves, thyme and garlic. Cover and re-frigerate overnight. Dry the duck with clean paper towels. Place it, skin side up, in a clean roasting pan, just large enough to hold the pieces in one layer. Bake the duck at 325F (160C) until brown, approx-imately 15 to 20 minutes. Add enough melted duck or goose fat to cover the pieces completely. Cover the pan and cook in a 300F (150C) oven until the duck is very tender, approximately 2 hours. Remove the duck from the fat and place in a deep hotel pan. Ladle enough of the cooking fat over the pieces to cover them completely. Be careful not to add any of the cooking juices. Cover the pan and refrigerate for 2 days to allow the flavors to mellow. To serve, remove the duck from the fat and scrape off the excess fat. Bake at 350F (180C) until the skin is crisp and the meat is hot, approximately 30 minutes.

fields.name: Duxelles Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'wine-dry-white': ['dry white wine', '12 fl oz', 'wine-dry-white'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '1 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'demi-glace': ['Demi-Glace', '1 pt', 'demi-glace'], 'mushrooms-medium': ['medium mushrooms', '8 oz', 'mushrooms-medium'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '1 tbl', 'parsley-fresh'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '2 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '3 oz', 'shallot'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '1 fl oz', 'clarified-butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Saut the mushrooms and shallot in the butter and oil. The mushrooms will release their liquid and darken. Cook until completely dry. Deglaze with the wine and reduce by two-thirds. Add the demi-glace. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the cream. Adjust the seasonings. Garnish with parsley.

fields.name: Venison Medallions (5 oz)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'venison-boneless-loin': ['boneless loin venison', '1 ea', 'venison-boneless-loin']}
fields.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim venison of all sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 5 oz medallions. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator

fields.name: Home-Style Meatloaf
fields.ingredient_amount: {'celery': ['celery', '8 oz', 'celery'], 'tomato-juice': ['tomato juice', '1 pt', 'tomato-juice'], 'beef-ground': ['ground beef', '4 lb', 'beef-ground'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '2 tbl', 'garlic'], 'salt': ['salt', '4 tsp', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '2 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'pork-ground': ['ground pork', '4 lb', 'pork-ground'], 'onion': ['onion', '1 lb', 'onion'], 'fresh-bread-crumbs': ['Fresh Bread Crumbs', '6 oz', 'fresh-bread-crumbs'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '4 ea', 'eggs'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1 tbl', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '4 tbl', 'parsley-fresh'], 'worcestershire-sauce': ['worcestershire sauce', '3 tbl', 'worcestershire-sauce'], 'ketchup': ['ketchupas needed', '', 'ketchup']}
fields.directions: Saut the onions, celery and garlic in the oil until tender. Remove from the heat and cool. Combine all the ingredients except the ketchup and mix well. Form into loaves of the desired size and place in loaf pans. Brush the top of each loaf with ketchup as desired. Bake at 350F (180C) until the meatloaf reaches an internal temperature of 165F (74C), approximately 1 hour for a 9-inch  5-inch (22-centimeter  12-centimeter) loaf pan. Allow the loaves to rest for 15 minutes before slicing. Cut slices of the desired thickness and serve with a tomato or mushroom sauce.

fields.name: Grapefruit Juice (fresh)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'grapefruit-white': ['white grapefruit', '5 ea', 'grapefruit-white']}
fields.directions: Directions: Wash grapefruits in cold water Using electric or hand juicer, juice into a fine mesh strainer over a clean (non-reactive) container. Refrigerate.

fields.name: Allemande Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '24 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'veal-velouta': ['Veal VeloutÃ©', '1 gal', 'veal-velouta'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '1 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '8 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Bring the velout to a simmer. In a stainless steel bowl, whip the egg yolks with the cream to create a liaison. Ladle approx-imately one-third of the hot velout sauce into this mixture, while whisking, to temper the yolk-and-cream mixture. When one-third of the velout has been incorporated into the now-warmed yolk-and-cream mixture, gradually add the liaison to the remaining velout sauce while whisking continuous-ly. Reheat the sauce. Do not let it boil. Add the lemon juice; season with salt and white pepper  to taste. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth.

fields.name: Shrimp and Avocado Omelet
fields.ingredient_amount: {'avocado': ['avocado', '1/4 ea', 'avocado'], 'onion-green': ['green onion', '1 tbl', 'onion-green'], 'shrimp-16-20-ct': ['16-20 ct shrimp', '3 oz', 'shrimp-16-20-ct'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '3 ea', 'eggs'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '2 tbl', 'clarified-butter'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '2 tsp', 'cilantro-fresh'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Saut the shrimp and onion in half of the butter until the shrimp is firm and the onion is translucent, approximately 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside. Heat an omelet pan and add the remaining butter. Whisk the eggs together in a small bowl, season with salt and pepper and pour into the ome-let pan. Stir the eggs as they cook. Stop when they begin to set. Lift the edges as the omelet cooks to allow the raw eggs to run underneath. When the eggs are nearly set, add the shrimp filling, avocado and cilantro. Fold the front of the eggs over and roll the omelet onto a plate.

fields.name: Passion Fruit Crme Chiboust
fields.ingredient_amount: {'gelatin-sheet': ['sheet gelatin', '1/4 oz', 'gelatin-sheet'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '3 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'passion-fruit-juice': ['passion fruit juice', '6 fl oz', 'passion-fruit-juice'], 'sugar-confectioners': ['confectioners sugaras needed', '', 'sugar-confectioners'], 'water': ['water', '2 fl oz', 'water'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '5 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'cornstarch': ['cornstarch', '1 oz', 'cornstarch'], 'egg-whites': ['egg whites', '5 ea', 'egg-whites'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '8 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Bring the passion fruit juice and cream to a boil in a large stainless saucepan. 2 Whisk the egg yolks and 3 ounces (90 grams) of the sugar to a ribbon, then add the corn-starch. Temper with half of the hot cream. 3 Return the tempered egg mixture to the saucepan and bring to a boil while vigorously whisk-ing. Once the custard has come to a boil and thickened, remove from heat and pour into a clean bowl. 4 Stir the softened sheet gelatin into the cream until it is dissolved and smooth. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and lightly dust the surface with powdered sugar to prevent a crust from forming. Do not chill the cream. 5 Meanwhile, prepare an Italian meringue as described on page 1173 with the egg whites, re-maining sugar and water. Delicately fold the Italian meringue into the hot passion fruit cream. 6 Use immediately. Pour the cream into a serving container or torte or other mold before it sets. This will keep refrigerated for several days.

fields.name: Beef Stroganoff
fields.ingredient_amount: {'beef-tenderloin': ['beef tenderloin', '2 lb', 'beef-tenderloin'], 'egg-noodles': ['egg noodles', '24 oz', 'egg-noodles'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'onion': ['onion', '4 oz', 'onion'], 'mushrooms-button': ['button mushrooms', '1 lb', 'mushrooms-button'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '10 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'cream-sour': ['sour cream', '8 oz', 'cream-sour'], 'demi-glace': ['Demi-Glace', '10 fl oz', 'demi-glace'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '1 tbl', 'parsley-fresh'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustard', '1 tbl', 'mustard-dijon'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'dill-fresh': ['fresh dill', '1 tbl', 'dill-fresh'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '3 tbl', 'clarified-butter']}
fields.directions: Saut the tenderloin tips in the butter, searing on all sides. Remove the meat and set aside. Add the onion to the pan and saut lightly. Add the mushrooms and saut until dry. Add the demi-glace. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Add the cream, sour cream, mustard and any meat juices that accumulated while holding the meat. Return the meat to the sauce to reheat. Stir in the dill and parsley. Adjust the seasonings and serve over hot egg noodles.

fields.name: Mashed Potatoes
fields.ingredient_amount: {'butter': ['butter', '4 oz', 'butter'], 'milk': ['milk', '8 fl oz', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt', '2 tsp', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper', '1/4 tsp', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'potato-russet': ['russet potato', '5 lb', 'potato-russet']}
fields.directions: Wash and peel the potatoes. Cut each potato into four to six uniform-sized pieces. Place the potatoes in a pot, cover them with water and add 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) salt to the water. Bring the water to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook until the potatoes are ten-der. Do not overcook the potatoes. When the potatoes are cooked, drain them well in a colander. The potatoes must be very dry. Transfer them to the bowl of an electric mixer. Using the whip attachment, whip the potatoes for 30 to 45 seconds. Scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl and whip for another 15 sec-onds or until the potatoes are smooth and free of lumps. The potatoes must be smooth before adding any liquids or they will remain lumpy. Add the butter, milk and seasonings. Whip on low speed to incorporate all of the ingredients. Scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl and whip again for several seconds. Adjust consis-tency and seasoning. VARIATIONS: Garlic Mashed PotatoesSweat 1 ounce (30 grams) chopped garlic in the melted butter for 5 to 10 minutes without browning. Strain the butter if desired. Add the hot garlic butter in place of the melted butter in the recipe. Horseradish Mashed PotatoesAdd 1 ounce (30 grams) freshly grated horseradish to the pota-toes with the seasonings. Truffle Mashed PotatoesAdd 112 fluid ounces (45 milliliters) truffle oil to the potatoes with the seasonings.

fields.name: Celery Juice
fields.ingredient_amount: {'celery': ['celery', '1 bunch', 'celery']}
fields.directions: Cut celery into large chunks. Place in heavy duty Acme juicer. Collect and store juice in clean container.

fields.name: White Roux
fields.ingredient_amount: {'butter': ['butter', '1 lb', 'butter'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '1 lb', 'flour-all-purpose']}
fields.directions: White roux is cooked only briefly and should be removed from the heat as soon as it devel-ops a frothy, bubbly appearance. It is used in white sauces, such as bchamel, or in dishes where little or no color is desired.

fields.name: Challah
fields.ingredient_amount: {'egg-wash': ['Egg Washas needed', '', 'egg-wash'], 'yeast-dry-active': ['dry active yeast', '1/2 oz', 'yeast-dry-active'], 'sesame-seeds': ['sesame seedsas needed', '', 'sesame-seeds'], 'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '1, 12 lb', 'flour-bread'], 'water': ['water', '5 fl oz', 'water'], 'honey': ['honey', '3 fl oz', 'honey'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '4 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '4 ea', 'eggs']}
fields.directions: Stir together the honey, salt and 8 ounces (240 grams) flour in a mixer bowl. Dissolve the yeast in the hot water. Add the yeast mixture, warm water, eggs and butter to the mixer bowl. Stir until smooth. Using a dough hook, knead the dough on medium speed, adding the remaining flour 2 ounces (60 grams) at a time until smooth and elastic, approximately 5 minutes. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl, cover and let the dough ferment until doubled, ap-proximately 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Punch down the dough and divide into six equal portions. Roll each portion into a long strip, about 1 inch (2.5 centimeters) in diameter and 12 inches (30 centimeters) long. Lay three strips side by side and braid. Pinch the ends together, then roll the ends of the braid to seal. Tuck the ends under the loaf. Place the loaf on a paper-lined sheet pan. Braid the three remaining pieces of dough in the same manner. Place the loaves on a paper-lined sheet pan. Brush the loaves with egg wash and sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds. Proof until doubled, approximately 45 minutes. Bake at 350F (170C) until the loaves are golden brown and sound hollow when thumped, approximately 40 minutes.

fields.name: Grilled Lamb Chops with Herb Butter
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'herb-butter': ['Herb Butter', '6 ea', 'herb-butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oilas needed', '', 'oil-vegetable'], 'lamb-chops-rib': ['rib lamb chops', '6 ea', 'lamb-chops-rib']}
fields.directions: Preheat the grill for 15 minutes. Brush the lamb chops with oil; season with salt and pepper. Place the lamb chops on the grill, turning as necessary to produce the proper crosshatching. Cook to the desired doneness. Remove the lamb chops from the grill and place a slice or rosette of herb butter on each chop. Serve immediately as the herb butter melts. The plate can be placed under the broiler for a few seconds to help melt the herb butter.

fields.name: Coconut Macadamia Cake
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '10 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'macadamia-nuts-whole': ['whole macadamia nuts', '6 oz', 'macadamia-nuts-whole'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '10 oz', 'sugar-granulated'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '13 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'coconut-macaroon': ['macaroon coconut', '9 oz', 'coconut-macaroon'], 'egg-whites': ['egg whites', '8 ea', 'egg-whites'], 'flour-cake': ['cake flour', '4 oz', 'flour-cake'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 tbl', 'vanilla-extract']}
fields.directions: 1 In a large bowl, whisk the yolks and sugar until well combined. Add the cream, then the coconut, vanilla extract and flour. Fold in the nuts. 2 In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites to medium stiff peaks. Fold one-third of the whipped egg whites into the coconut mixture, then delicately fold in the rest of the egg whites. 3 Divide the cake batter evenly between buttered and floured cake pans. Bake at 375F (190C) until the center of the cake bounces back when lightly pressed, approximately 20 minutes. Cool completely before using.

fields.name: Sweetbreads Grenoble
fields.ingredient_amount: {'wine-dry-white': ['dry white wine', '2 fl oz', 'wine-dry-white'], 'capers': ['capers', '3 oz', 'capers'], 'lemon': ['lemon', '3 ea', 'lemon'], 'veal-sweetbreads': ['veal sweetbreads', '8 ea', 'veal-sweetbreads'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '4 oz', 'butter'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flouras needed', '', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'veal-demi-glace': ['Veal Demi-Glace', '2 fl oz', 'veal-demi-glace'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '2 fl oz', 'clarified-butter']}
fields.directions: Slice the sweetbreads and season with salt and pepper. Dust each piece lightly with flour. Heat the clarified butter in a large saut pan; add the sweetbreads and cook on each side for 1 to 2 minutes, until golden brown. Transfer the sweetbreads to a roasting pan and bake in a 375F (190C) oven for 5 minutes. Deglaze the saut pan with the wine. Add the whole butter, capers and lemon segments and cook over high heat for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the demi-glace and cook until thoroughly heated, approximately 1 more minute. Arrange the sweetbreads on plates and top with the sauce.

fields.name: Jus Li
fields.ingredient_amount: {'water': ['wateras needed', '', 'water'], 'brown-stock': ['Brown Stock', '1 qt', 'brown-stock'], 'cornstarch': ['cornstarchas needed', '', 'cornstarch']}
fields.directions: Jus Li Jus li (zhoo lee-ay), also known as fond li, is used like a demi-glace, especially to pro-duce small sauces. Jus li is lighter and easier to make than a demi-glace, however. It is made in one of two ways: 1.A rich brown stock is thickened with cornstarch or arrowroot and seasoned. 2.A rich brown stock is simmered and reduced so that it thickens naturally because of the con-centrated amounts of gelatin and other proteins. The starch-thickened method is a quick alternative to the long-simmering demi-glace. But be-cause it is simply a brown stock thickened with cornstarch or arrowroot, it will be only as good as the stock with which it was begun. Sauces made from reduced stock usually have a better flavor but can be expensive to produce because of high food costs and lengthy reduction time. A properly made jus li is very rich and smooth. It shares many flavor characteristics with demi-glace. Its color should be dark brown and glossy from the concentrated gelatin content. Its consistency is somewhat lighter than demi-glace, but it should still cling lightly to foods.

fields.name: Lemon Pesto
fields.ingredient_amount: {'oil-extra-virgin-olive': ['extra virgin olive oil', '10 fl oz', 'oil-extra-virgin-olive'], 'lemon': ['lemon', '4 ea', 'lemon'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '5 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '1 1/2 oz', 'parsley-fresh'], 'basil-fresh': ['fresh basil', '4 oz', 'basil-fresh'], 'salt': ['salt', '2 tsp', 'salt']}
fields.directions: 1 Zest the lemons. Combine the zest, garlic, basil, parsley and salt in a food processor fitted with a metal blade. Process until minced. 2 With the motor running, drizzle in the oil to form a sauce.

fields.name: Veal Stock
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '2 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'water': ['water', '3 gal', 'water'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'veal-bones': ['veal bones', '15 lb', 'veal-bones'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '12 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black']}
fields.directions: Cut the washed bones into pieces approximately 34 inches (810 centimeters) long. Place the bones in a stockpot and cover them with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: New York Strip Steak (10 oz)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'beef-strip-loin': ['beef strip loin', '1 ea', 'beef-strip-loin']}
fields.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim meat of all excess fat and sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut strip loin into 10 oz steaks. Place in hotel pans or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.

fields.name: Bourbon Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'bourbon': ['bourbon', '8 fl oz', 'bourbon'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '8 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1 lb', 'sugar-granulated'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '2 ea', 'eggs']}
fields.directions: Melt the butter; stir in the sugar and eggs and simmer to thicken. Add the bourbon and hold in a warm place for service.

fields.name: Velout
fields.ingredient_amount: {'butter': ['butter', '8 fl oz', 'butter'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '8 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '5 qt', 'chicken-stock'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Heat the butter in a heavy saucepan. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Gradually add the stock to the roux, stirring constantly with a whisk to prevent lumps. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. (Seasonings are optional; their use depends on the season-ings in the stock and the sauces intended use.) Simmer and reduce to 1 gallon (3.8 liters), approximately 30 minutes. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth. Melted butter may be carefully ladled over the surface of the sauce to prevent a skin from forming. Hold for service or cool in a water bath.

fields.name: Braised Short Ribs of Beef
fields.ingredient_amount: {'beef-short-ribs': ['beef short ribs', '6 lb', 'beef-short-ribs'], 'celery': ['celery', '4 oz', 'celery'], 'tomatoes-cherry': ['cherry tomatoesas needed', '', 'tomatoes-cherry'], 'rosemary-dried-whole': ['dried whole rosemary', '1/2 tsp', 'rosemary-dried-whole'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '1 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'onion': ['onion', '6 oz', 'onion'], 'scallions': ['scallions', '12 ea', 'scallions'], 'roux': ['Rouxas needed', '', 'roux'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '4 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'mashed-potatoes': ['Mashed Potatoesas needed', '', 'mashed-potatoes']}
fields.directions: Combine the flour, salt, pepper and rosemary. Dredge the ribs in the seasoned flour. Heat the oil in a heavy brazier and brown the ribs well. Remove and hold in a warm place. Add the onion and celery to the brazier and saut lightly. Return the ribs to the pan, add the stock and cook in a 300F (150C) oven until done, ap-proximately 212 hours. Remove the ribs from the liquid and skim off the excess fat. Bring the liquid to a boil on the stove top; thicken it with roux to the desired consistency and simmer for 15 minutes. Strain the sauce and adjust the seasonings. Return the ribs to the sauce and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve the ribs with mashed potatoes garnished with the scallions, some cherry tomatoes and additional sauce. VARIATIONS: Orange-Scented Braised Short Ribs of BeefOmit the rosemary. Add 4 tablespoons (60 millili-ters) julienned orange zest and 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) orange juice in step 4. Decrease the stock by 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters). Ginger Braised Short Ribs of BeefOmit the rosemary. Saut 3 ounces (90 grams) peeled and chopped fresh ginger with the onions and celery in step 3. Substitute 2 fluid ounces (60 millili-ters) soy sauce for an equal amount of the beef stock and add 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) ground ginger to the ribs before braising in step 4.

fields.name: Pheasant Stock
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '2 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pheasant-whole': ['whole pheasant', '5 lb', 'pheasant-whole'], 'water': ['water', '3 gal', 'water'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '8 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'chicken-backs-and-necks': ['chicken backs and necks', '5 lb', 'chicken-backs-and-necks'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'pheasant-trimmings-from-production': ['pheasant trimmings [from production]', '5 lb', 'pheasant-trimmings-from-production']}
fields.directions: Cut the pheasant into pieces. Take the breast meat off the frame and reserve for other use. Place pheasant, chicken backs and necks, and trimmings in a stockpot and cover with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: Milanaise Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'ham': ['ham', '5 oz', 'ham'], 'beef-tongue': ['beef tongue', '5 oz', 'beef-tongue'], 'mushrooms-medium': ['medium mushrooms', '5 oz', 'mushrooms-medium'], 'tomato-sauce': ['Tomato Sauce', '1 qt', 'tomato-sauce'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '1/2 oz', 'butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Saut 5 ounces (150 grams) sliced mushrooms in 12 ounce (15 grams) whole butter. Add tomato sauce and then stir in 5 ounces (150 grams) cooked ham (julienne) and 5 ounces (150 grams) cooked tongue (julienne). Bring to a simmer. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Egg, Bacon, Lettuce and Tomato Breakfast Sandwich
fields.ingredient_amount: {'bread-sourdough': ['sourdough bread', '2 slice', 'bread-sourdough'], 'bacon': ['bacon', '3 slice', 'bacon'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '1 ea', 'eggs'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'lettuce-bibb': ['bibb lettuce', '2 leaf', 'lettuce-bibb'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 tsp', 'butter-unsalted'], 'cheese-cheddar': ['cheddar cheese', '2 slice', 'cheese-cheddar'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '3 slice', 'tomatoes-fresh'], 'mayonnaise': ['mayonnaise', '1 tbl', 'mayonnaise']}
fields.directions: Toast the bread slices. Lay them out facing each other on a cutting board. Spread one slice with the mayonnaise. Position the lettuce on the bread and top with the bacon and the tomato slices. Place the Cheddar cheese on the other slice. Heat a small nonstick saut pan over medium heat. Add the butter. Crack the egg into the pan, season with salt and pepper and cook, turning once, until the white is cooked and the yolk is still runny. Place the egg on top of the tomatoes. Close the sandwich and serve immediately.

fields.name: Veal Cutlets
fields.ingredient_amount: {'veal-top-round': ['veal top round', '6 lb', 'veal-top-round']}
fields.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim veal of all sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into cutlets of desired size. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.

fields.name: Poulette Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '1 tbl', 'parsley-fresh'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '2 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '1/2 oz', 'shallot'], 'mushrooms-medium': ['medium mushrooms', '8 oz', 'mushrooms-medium'], 'butter': ['butter', '1 oz', 'butter'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh) to taste', '', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'allemande-sauce': ['Allemande Sauce', '1 qt', 'allemande-sauce'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Saut 8 ounces (240 grams) sliced mushrooms and 12 ounce (15 grams) diced shallot in 1 ounce (30 grams) whole butter. Add to the allemande; then add 2 fluid ounces (60 milliliters) heavy cream. Finish with lemon juice  to taste and 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) chopped parsley. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Basic Berry Muffins
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lemon-zest': ['Lemon Zest', '2 tbl', 'lemon-zest'], 'baking-powder': ['baking powder', '6 tbl', 'baking-powder'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt', '1 tbl', 'salt-kosher'], 'nutmeg-ground': ['ground nutmeg', '1/4 tsp', 'nutmeg-ground'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '8 ea', 'eggs'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 qt', 'cream-heavy'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 lb', 'butter-unsalted'], 'flour-cake': ['cake flour', '3 lb', 'flour-cake'], 'blueberries': ['blueberries', '1, 8 lb', 'blueberries'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1, 4 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Whisk the eggs, cream and zest together by hand. Sift the dry ingredients together. Add the berries or nuts, tossing to coat them evenly with the flour mixture. Add the dry ingredients to the egg mixture and stir until about two-thirds mixed. Add the melted butter and finish mixing. Portion into greased muffin tins and bake at 375F (190C) for approximately 15 to 18 min-utes.

fields.name: Roasted Corn Chowder
fields.ingredient_amount: {'potato-white': ['white potato', '12 oz', 'potato-white'], 'celery': ['celery', '5 oz', 'celery'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '2 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'nutmeg-ground': ['ground nutmeg to taste', '', 'nutmeg-ground'], 'corn-fresh': ['fresh corn', '10 ea', 'corn-fresh'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '4 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'milk': ['milk', '3 pt', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '4 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'onion': ['onion', '10 oz', 'onion'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '1 qt', 'chicken-stock'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1 tsp', 'thyme-fresh'], 'worcestershire-sauce': ['worcestershire sauce', '1 tbl', 'worcestershire-sauce'], 'salt-pork': ['salt pork', '4 oz', 'salt-pork'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Roast the ears of corn, in their husks, in a 400F (200C) oven for 45 minutes. Cool, shuck the corn and cut off the kernels. Pure half the corn kernels in a blender, adding a small amount of milk if necessary. Render the salt pork. Add the celery, onions and garlic and saut lightly. Stir in the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Add the stock and remaining milk and bring to a simmer. Add the potatoes, the pured corn and the remaining corn kernels. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the cream; adjust the seasonings with Worcestershire sauce, thyme, nutmeg, salt and white pepper and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve in warm bowls.

fields.name: French Bread Croutons
fields.ingredient_amount: {'bread-french': ['French bread', '1 loaf', 'bread-french']}
fields.directions: Using serrated bread knife, cut bread into 1/4" thick slices. Spread on sheet pan and toast until very light golden brown.

fields.name: Duchesse Potatoes
fields.ingredient_amount: {'nutmeg-ground': ['ground nutmeg', '1/8 tsp', 'nutmeg-ground'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '1 ea', 'eggs'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '1 oz', 'butter'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '2 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'potato-russet': ['russet potato', '2 lb', 'potato-russet'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butteras needed', '', 'clarified-butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Peel and quarter the potatoes. Then boil them in salted water until tender. Drain and immediately turn them out onto a sheet pan to allow the moisture to evaporate. While still warm, press the potatoes through a grinder or food mill, or grind through a grinders medium die. Blend in the butter and season  to taste with nutmeg, salt and pepper. Mix in the eggs and egg yolks, blending well. Transfer the duchesse mixture to a piping bag fitted with a large star tip. Pipe single portion-sized spirals onto a parchment-lined sheet pan. Brush with clarified butter and bake at 375F (190C) until the edges are golden brown, approximately 8 to 10 minutes. Serve immedi-ately. Note: Duchesse potatoes are often used to decorate platters used for buffets or tableside prepara-tions or to present chteaubriand. To create borders and garnishes, the standard mixture for duchesse potatoes is forced through a piping bag while still very hot and relatively soft. VARIATION: Potato CroquettesShape the duchesse mixture into short cylinders resembling fat corks. Coat the cylinders with bread crumbs using the standard breading procedure described in Chapter 8, Mise en Place. Using the basket method, deep-fry at 360F (182C) until golden brown.

fields.name: Crme Chantilly (Chantilly Cream)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 qt', 'cream-heavy'], 'sugar-confectioners': ['confectioners sugar', '3 oz', 'sugar-confectioners'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '2 tsp', 'vanilla-extract']}
fields.directions: Place the cream in a chilled mixing bowl. Using a balloon whisk, whisk the cream until slightly thickened. Add the sugar and vanilla and continue whisking to the desired consistency. The cream should be smooth and light, not grainy. Do not overwhip. Crme Chantilly may be stored in the refrigerator for several hours. If the cream begins to soften, gently rewhip as necessary. VARIATION: Chocolate ChantillyMelt 1 pound 2 ounces (540 grams) bittersweet chocolate to 120F (49C) and remove from heat. Whip the cream to medium peaks. Whisk one-fourth of the whipped cream into the chocolate vigorously. Gently fold in the remaining cream. This mixture will have the texture of velvety ganache.

fields.name: Chevreuil Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'wine-white': ['white wine', '4 fl oz', 'wine-white'], 'bacon': ['bacon', '6 oz', 'bacon'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '2 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'wine-red': ['red wine', '4 fl oz', 'wine-red'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'vinegar-wine': ['wine vinegar', '16 fl oz', 'vinegar-wine'], 'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '12 oz', 'mirepoix'], 'butter': ['butter', '2 oz', 'butter'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'demi-glace': ['Demi-Glace', '1 qt', 'demi-glace'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1 sprig', 'thyme-fresh'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '20 ea', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '4 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'pepper-cayenne': ['cayenne pepper', '1 pinch', 'pepper-cayenne']}
fields.directions: Prepare a poivrade sauce but add 6 ounces (180 grams) bacon or game trimmings to the mirepoix. Finish with 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) red wine and a dash of cayenne pepper. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Harvest Lobster and Corn Chowder
fields.ingredient_amount: {'celery': ['celery', '4 oz', 'celery'], 'chives-fresh': ['fresh chives', '1 tbl', 'chives-fresh'], 'corn-fresh': ['fresh corn', '4 oz', 'corn-fresh'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '2 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'water': ['water', '2 qt', 'water'], 'clam-juice': ['clam juice', '8 fl oz', 'clam-juice'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'carrot': ['carrot', '8 oz', 'carrot'], 'wine-dry-white': ['dry white wine', '8 fl oz', 'wine-dry-white'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '12 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'onion': ['onion', '3 oz', 'onion'], 'tomato-paste': ['tomato paste', '2 tbl', 'tomato-paste'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '2 oz', 'butter'], 'cognac': ['cognac', '1 fl oz', 'cognac'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '4 tbl', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'pepper-red-bell': ['red bell pepper', '3 oz', 'pepper-red-bell'], 'lobster-1-a-lb': ['1 Â¼ lb lobster', '1 ea', 'lobster-1-a-lb']}
fields.directions: Combine the water, wine, onions, celery, carrots, garlic and clam juice in a saucepot and bring to a boil. Add the lobster and cook for 8 minutes. Remove the lobster from the cooking liquid and remove the lobster meat from the shell. Crush the shell and return it to the cooking liquid with the tomato paste, peppercorns, bay leaf and Cognac. Simmer the stock for 1 hour to extract as much flavor from the lobster shell and vegetables as possible. Strain the stock through a china cap, pressing firmly with the back of a ladle to remove as much liquid as possible from the shells. This should yield approximately 24 fluid ounces (720 milliliters) liquid. Add more water should there be insufficient stock. Heat the butter in a heavy saucepot. Sweat the bell pepper, onion and garlic for 1 minute. Add the flour to make a roux and cook for 5 minutes. Whisk in the stock, bring to a boil, re-duce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Add the corn kernels. Scald the cream and add it to the soup. Bring the soup to a simmer and adjust the seasonings. Dice the lobster meat and add it to the soup. Serve the soup garnished with chives.

fields.name: Braised Rhubarb
fields.ingredient_amount: {'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '4 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'orange-juice': ['orange juice', '2 fl oz', 'orange-juice'], 'cinnamon-ground': ['ground cinnamon', '1 tbl', 'cinnamon-ground'], 'nutmeg-ground': ['ground nutmeg', '1/4 tsp', 'nutmeg-ground'], 'wine-sweet-white': ['sweet white wine', '8 fl oz', 'wine-sweet-white'], 'sugar-light-brown': ['light brown sugar', '14 oz', 'sugar-light-brown'], 'apple-granny-smith': ['granny smith apple', '2, 8 lb', 'apple-granny-smith'], 'rhubarb-iqf': ['IQF rhubarb', '7 lb', 'rhubarb-iqf'], 'salt': ['salt', '1/2 tsp', 'salt'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '2 tsp', 'vanilla-extract']}
fields.directions: Saut the apples and rhubarb in the butter until they begin to soften. Add the wine and reduce by half. Add the remaining ingredients. Simmer until the rhubarb is very tender. Serve at room temperature in prebaked pastry cups, topped with crme chantilly or crme frache and fennel greens, or serve warm over ice cream.

fields.name: Ricotta Filling
fields.ingredient_amount: {'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '5 oz', 'sugar-granulated'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 tsp', 'vanilla-extract'], 'cheese-ricotta': ['ricotta cheese', '10 oz', 'cheese-ricotta'], 'flour-pastry': ['pastry flour', '4 oz', 'flour-pastry'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '2 ea', 'eggs'], 'cheese-cream': ['cream cheese', '1, 8 lb', 'cheese-cream']}
fields.directions: In the bowl of a mixer fitted with a paddle, combine the cream cheese and ricotta on low speed until no lumps remain. Add the sugar; gradually add the eggs and scrape down the bowl between additions. Add the vanilla extract and then the flour and combine well.

fields.name: English Muffin Loaves
fields.ingredient_amount: {'yeast-dry-active': ['dry active yeast', '1/2 oz', 'yeast-dry-active'], 'cornmeal-yellow': ['yellow cornmealas needed', '', 'cornmeal-yellow'], 'water': ['water', '4 fl oz', 'water'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '1, 8 lb', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'milk': ['milk', '1 pt', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt', '2 tsp', 'salt'], 'baking-soda': ['baking soda', '1/4 tsp', 'baking-soda'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1 tbl', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Stir together the yeast, sugar, baking soda, salt and 12 ounces (360 grams) flour. Combine the milk and water and heat to 120F (49C). Stir the warm liquids into the dry ingredients, beating well. Add enough of the remaining flour to make a stiff batter. Spoon the batter into loaf pans that have been greased and dusted with cornmeal. Proof until doubled. Bake at 400F (200C) until golden brown and done, approximately 25 minutes.

fields.name: Herb Cheese Spread
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1/2 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'salt-sea': ['sea salt', '1/2 tsp', 'salt-sea'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '1 tbl', 'parsley-fresh'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1/2 oz', 'garlic'], 'chives-fresh': ['fresh chives', '2 tbl', 'chives-fresh'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '4 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper', '1/4 tsp', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'cheese-cream': ['cream cheese', '1 lb', 'cheese-cream']}
fields.directions: Blend the butter and cream cheese in the bowl of a mixer fitted with the paddle attachment on medium speed until smooth. Dissolve the salt in the cream. Add the cream and remaining ingredients to the cheese. Scrape down the bowl and blend thoroughly. Pack the cheese mixture into five 4-ounce molds lined with plastic wrap. Chill thoroughly before using. This herb cheese will keep for up to 4 days in the refrigerator.

fields.name: Rouille
fields.ingredient_amount: {'garlic': ['garlic', '2 tsp', 'garlic'], 'bread-white': ['white bread', '1 slice', 'bread-white'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '8 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'pepper-cayenne': ['cayenne pepper', '1/4 tsp', 'pepper-cayenne']}
fields.directions: 1 Tear the bread and place in the bowl of a food processor. Process for 40 seconds to make fresh bread crumbs. 2 Add the garlic and cayenne pepper and process to blend. 3 Slowly drizzle in the oil until the mixture resembles mayonnaise. Add a small amount of warm water if necessary to thin the sauce and make it creamier. 4 Adjust the seasoning with salt.

fields.name: Parsnip Pure
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '8 oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'parsnip': ['parsnip', '4 lb', 'parsnip'], 'butter': ['butter', '4 oz', 'butter'], 'potato-russet': ['russet potato', '1, 8 lb', 'potato-russet'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Peel the parsnips and potatoes and cut into large pieces of approximately the same size. Boil the vegetables separately in salted water until tender. Drain the vegetables well. Pure them together through a food mill. Add the cream and butter and mix to combine. Adjust the consistency by adding cream as desired. Season the mixture with salt and white pepper and serve hot. VARIATIONS: Turnip PureSubstitute turnips for the parsnips. Winter Squash PureSelect approximately 6 1/2 pounds (3 kilograms) winter squash (such as acorn, butternut, pumpkin) and cut them in halves or quarters. Scoop out the seeds and then roast the squash, cut side down, in a 375F (190C) oven until tender. Scoop the flesh from the shells and substitute it for the parsnips.

fields.name: Potato Chowder with Nisqually Smoked Salmon
fields.ingredient_amount: {'potato-yukon-gold': ['Yukon gold potato', '2 lb', 'potato-yukon-gold'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '8 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'prosciutto': ['prosciutto', '3 oz', 'prosciutto'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '3 pt', 'chicken-stock'], 'roux': ['Roux', '4 oz', 'roux'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'salmon-nisqually-smoked': ['Nisqually smoked salmon', '6 oz', 'salmon-nisqually-smoked'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'onion': ['onion', '4 oz', 'onion'], 'dill-weed': ['dill weed', '2 tsp', 'dill-weed']}
fields.directions: Place the prosciutto in a heavy saucepot and sweat for 2 minutes. Add the onion and saut until translucent. Add the potatoes and sweat for 3 minutes. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Add the roux and simmer to thicken the soup. When the potatoes are nearly tender, add the dill, thyme, cream and salmon. Gently stir to incorporate all of the flavors. Simmer for 5 minutes. Do not overcook the potatoes. Adjust the seasonings and serve imme-diately. VARIATION: Nonfat, 1% or 2% milk may be substituted for the cream in the recipe to lower the fat content.

fields.name: Blue Crab Cakes
fields.ingredient_amount: {'crabmeat-lump': ['lump crabmeat', '1 lb', 'crabmeat-lump'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '1 ea', 'eggs'], 'tabasco-sauce': ['tabasco sauce to taste', '', 'tabasco-sauce'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butteras needed', '', 'clarified-butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '6 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'onion-green': ['green onion', '1 bunch', 'onion-green'], 'pepper-green-bell': ['green bell pepper', '2 oz', 'pepper-green-bell'], 'fresh-bread-crumbs': ['Fresh Bread Crumbs', '6 oz', 'fresh-bread-crumbs'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustard', '1 tbl', 'mustard-dijon'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'worcestershire-sauce': ['worcestershire sauce to taste', '', 'worcestershire-sauce'], 'pepper-red-bell': ['red bell pepper', '2 oz', 'pepper-red-bell']}
fields.directions: Carefully pick through the crab meat, removing any pieces of shell. Keep the lumps of crab meat as large as possible. Place the cream in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce by approximately one-half. Chill the cream well. Saut the bell peppers in a small amount of clarified butter until tender. Combine the crab meat, reduced cream, bell peppers, green onions and approximately 3 ounces (90 grams) bread crumbs along with the salt, pepper, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce and egg. Mix to combine all ingredients, trying to keep the lumps of crab meat intact. Using a 2-ounce (60-gram) mold, form the crab mixture into cakes of the desired size. Place the remaining bread crumbs in an appropriately sized hotel pan. Place the crab cakes, a few at a time, in the hotel pan and cover with the bread crumbs. To help them adhere, press the crumbs lightly into the cakes. Heat a saut pan over moderate heat and add enough clarified butter to cover the bottom approximately 1/4 inch (6 millimeters) deep. Add the crab cakes to the pan and cook until done, turning once when the first side is nicely browned. Remove and drain on absorbent paper.

fields.name: Naan (Indian Flatbread)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-whole-wheat': ['whole wheat flour', '12 oz', 'flour-whole-wheat'], 'sesame-seeds-black': ['black sesame seedsas needed', '', 'sesame-seeds-black'], 'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '24 oz', 'flour-bread'], 'baking-powder': ['baking powder', '1/2 tsp', 'baking-powder'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oilas needed', '', 'oil-vegetable'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '2 tbl', 'oil-olive'], 'water': ['water', '17 fl oz', 'water'], 'yeast-fresh': ['fresh yeast', '1 tsp', 'yeast-fresh'], 'yogurt-plain': ['plain yogurt', '10 oz', 'yogurt-plain'], 'salt': ['salt', '3 1/2 tsp', 'salt'], 'baking-soda': ['baking soda', '1/2 tsp', 'baking-soda']}
fields.directions: To prepare the sponge, dissolve 1/2 teaspoon (2 milliliters) yeast in 6 fluid ounces (180 milliliters) water in the bowl of a mixer fitted with a dough hook. Add 8 ounces (240 grams) bread flour and mix until well incorporated. Cover and set aside. Ferment at room temperature until cracks appear on the surface of the starter, approximately 3 hours. Place the sponge and the remaining 16 ounces (480 grams) bread flour, 11 fluid ounces (330 milliliters) water, whole-wheat flour, yogurt, olive oil, baking powder and baking soda in the bowl of a mixer fitted with a dough hook. Mix on low speed for 3 minutes. Stop the mixer and scrape down the bowl. Add the remaining compressed yeast and mix on high speed for an additional 3 minutes. Add the salt, then mix until the dough is smooth and elastic, approximately 5 minutes more. Let the dough ferment, covered, for 3 hours. Punch down the dough and divide it into 6 uniform pieces. Round the portioned dough. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes. Stretch each piece of dough out until it measures 12 inches (30 centimeters) long. Place the dough on flour-dusted sheet pans and proof until doubled, approximately 50 minutes. Dimple the surface of the dough with your fingertips.
