fields.directions: Soak the currants in the whiskey until plump, at least 1 hour. Sift the dry ingredients together. Stir in the currants and whiskey. Stir in the buttermilk, making a stiff batter. Spread the batter in a greased 8-inch (20-centimeter) round cake pan. Bake at 350F (180C) until well browned and firm, approximately 30 minutes.

fields.name: Venison Red Wine Jus
fields.ingredient_amount: {'celery': ['celery', '1/10 bunch', 'celery'], 'onion': ['onion', '2 oz', 'onion'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '2 ea', 'shallot'], 'wine-red': ['red wine', '1 pt', 'wine-red'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '2 tsp', 'garlic'], 'veal-stock': ['Veal Stock', '1 qt', 'veal-stock'], 'carrot': ['carrot', '3 oz', 'carrot'], 'bacon': ['bacon', '2 tbl', 'bacon']}
fields.directions: 1 In a medium saucepan, render the bacon over low heat. Add the shallots, carrot, garlic, celery and onion; cook until tender. 2 Add the red wine and reduce to a glaze. 3 Add the stock and reduce by two-thirds. Pass through a fine strainer and check the consisten-cy. Return to the saucepan and reduce further if necessary.

fields.name: Mango Chutney
fields.ingredient_amount: {'ginger-fresh': ['fresh ginger', '1 tsp', 'ginger-fresh'], 'lime-juice-fresh': ['Lime Juice (fresh)', '1 fl oz', 'lime-juice-fresh'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '2 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'sugar-dark-brown': ['dark brown sugar', '8 oz', 'sugar-dark-brown'], 'raisins-golden': ['golden raisins', '2 1/2 oz', 'raisins-golden'], 'mustard-seeds': ['mustard seeds', '1/2 tsp', 'mustard-seeds'], 'cinnamon-stick': ['cinnamon stick', '2 ea', 'cinnamon-stick'], 'salt': ['salt', '1/2 tsp', 'salt'], 'ginger-candied': ['candied ginger', '4 oz', 'ginger-candied'], 'mango': ['mango', '2 lb', 'mango'], 'onion': ['onion', '4 oz', 'onion'], 'pepper-crushed-red': ['crushed red pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-crushed-red'], 'vinegar-cider': ['cider vinegar', '8 fl oz', 'vinegar-cider']}
fields.directions: Combine the mangoes, onion, garlic, vinegar and sugar in a large, heavy saucepan. Cook until the sugar dissolves. Stir in the raisins, crystallized ginger, salt and spices. Simmer until the onion and raisins are very soft, approximately 45 minutes. Skim foam from the surface as necessary. Stir in the lime juice and adjust the seasonings. Remove from the heat and cool uncovered. The chutney will thicken somewhat as it cools but should be thinner than fruit preserves.

fields.name: Grilled Veal Chop with Wild Mushroom Ragot
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'wild-mushroom-ragoa-t': ['Wild Mushroom RagoÃ»tas needed', '', 'wild-mushroom-ragoa-t'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '4 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'veal-chop-8-oz': ['veal chop 8 oz', '8 ea', 'veal-chop-8-oz']}
fields.directions: Brush the veal chops with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill over a hot grill to the de-sired doneness. Arrange each chop with side dishes as desired; top with Wild Mushroom Ragot.

fields.name: Aunt Ruthie's Pot Roast
fields.ingredient_amount: {'brown-veal-stock': ['Brown Veal Stock', '1 qt', 'brown-veal-stock'], 'paprika': ['paprika', '1 tsp', 'paprika'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '8 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'sugar-light-brown': ['light brown sugar', '4 oz', 'sugar-light-brown'], 'vinegar-red-wine': ['red wine vinegar', '8 fl oz', 'vinegar-red-wine'], 'mustard-dry': ['dry mustard', '2 tsp', 'mustard-dry'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '3 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'ketchup': ['ketchup', '8 oz', 'ketchup'], 'onion': ['onion', '3 lb', 'onion'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '2 tbl', 'garlic'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'tomato-sauce': ['tomato sauce', '1 pt', 'tomato-sauce'], 'worcestershire-sauce': ['worcestershire sauce', '2 fl oz', 'worcestershire-sauce'], 'beef-brisket': ['beef brisket', '6 lb', 'beef-brisket']}
fields.directions: Heat the oil in a large rondeau. Add the beef and brown thoroughly. Remove and reserve the brisket. Add the onions and garlic to the pan and saut. Add the stock and tomato sauce to the pan. Return the brisket to the pan, cover tightly and bring to a boil. Braise at 325F (160C) for 112 hours, basting or turning the brisket often. Combine the remaining ingredients and add to the pan. Continue cooking and basting the brisket until tender, approximately 1 hour. Add additional stock or water as needed during braising. Remove the brisket, degrease the sauce and adjust its consistency and seasonings. Do not strain the sauce. Slice the brisket against the grain and serve with the sauce.

fields.name: Chilled Cherry Soup
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cra-me-fraa-che': ['crÃ¨me fraÃ®cheas needed', '', 'cra-me-fraa-che'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh) to taste', '', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'apple-juice': ['apple juice', '2 qt', 'apple-juice'], 'wine-sparkling': ['sparkling wine', '8 fl oz', 'wine-sparkling'], 'almonds-sliced': ['sliced almondsas needed', '', 'almonds-sliced'], 'honey': ['honey', '6 oz', 'honey'], 'cornstarch': ['cornstarch', '1 oz', 'cornstarch'], 'cinnamon-stick': ['cinnamon stick', '2 ea', 'cinnamon-stick'], 'cherries-dark': ['dark cherries', '5 lb', 'cherries-dark'], 'cloves-whole': ['whole cloves', '4 ea', 'cloves-whole']}
fields.directions: Combine the cherries, apple juice, sachet and honey. Bring to a simmer and cook for 30 min-utes. Remove the sachet. Dilute the cornstarch with a small amount of cold apple juice. Add it to the soup for thicken-ing. Simmer the soup for 10 minutes to cook out the starchy flavor. Pure the soup in a food processor or blender and strain if desired; chill thoroughly. At service, adjust the seasoning with lemon juice. Stir in chilled champagne or sparkling wine and serve garnished with crme frache and toasted sliced almonds.

fields.name: Tomatillo Salsa
fields.ingredient_amount: {'tomatillos': ['tomatillos', '5 lb', 'tomatillos'], 'onion': ['onion', '4 oz', 'onion'], 'water': ['water', '8 fl oz', 'water'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '2 tbl', 'garlic'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '2 oz', 'cilantro-fresh'], 'pepper-jalapeno-chile': ['jalapeno chile pepper', '3 ea', 'pepper-jalapeno-chile']}
fields.directions: Remove the husks from the tomatillos. Combine the tomatillos with the water, jalapeos, salt, pepper, garlic and onion. Bring to a boil and simmer until tender, approximately 20 minutes. Chop the mixture in a food chopper or pure in a blender for a smoother sauce. Add the cilantro and adjust the seasonings. The sauce may be served warm or cold.

fields.name: Minute Steak Dijonaise
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '3 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'onion': ['onion', '2 oz', 'onion'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustard', '1 oz', 'mustard-dijon'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '1 oz', 'butter'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '1 fl oz', 'clarified-butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'beef-sirloin-steak': ['beef sirloin steak', '2 ea', 'beef-sirloin-steak']}
fields.directions: Pound the steaks to a 14-inch (6-millimeter) thickness. Cover one side of each sirloin first with 112 teaspoons (8 milliliters) mustard and then half of the onion, pressing the onion firmly into the steak. Saut the steaks in the clarified butter, presentation (onion) side down first. Remove and hold in a warm place. Degrease the pan. Add the cream and reduce by half. Add the rest of the mustard. Mont au beurre. Adjust the seasonings. Serve each portion with some of the sauce.

fields.name: Brennan's Lemon Butter Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '2 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'butter': ['butter', '2 lb', 'butter'], 'espagnole-brown-sauce': ['Espagnole (Brown Sauce)', '4 fl oz', 'espagnole-brown-sauce']}
fields.directions: Combine the brown sauce and lemon juice in a large saucepan. Working the pan on and off the direct heat, add the butter a bit at a time, whisking the sauce smooth between additions. Adjust the flavor with additional lemon juice if necessary. Transfer the sauce to a clean con-tainer and hold at room temperature for service. Use the sauce within 2 hours or discard it.

fields.name: Veal Demi-Glace
fields.ingredient_amount: {'brown-veal-stock': ['Brown Veal Stock', '1 qt', 'brown-veal-stock'], 'espagnole-brown-sauce': ['Espagnole (Brown Sauce)', '1 qt', 'espagnole-brown-sauce']}
fields.directions: Combine the stock and sauce in a saucepan over medium heat. Simmer until the mixture is reduced by half (a yield of 1 quart or 960 mL) Strain and cool in a water bath.

fields.name: Marinated London Broil
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vinegar-balsamic': ['balsamic vinegar', '4 fl oz', 'vinegar-balsamic'], 'rosemary-fresh': ['fresh rosemary', '2 tbl', 'rosemary-fresh'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '4 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'beef-flank-steak': ['beef flank steak', '2, 8 lb', 'beef-flank-steak'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '2 oz', 'garlic'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Combine the marinade ingredients in a hotel pan. Add the flank steak to the marinade and coat completely. Allow the meat to marinate for at least 4 hours. Grill the steak rare to medium rare. If cooked further, the meat will become extremely tough. Carve into 14-inch- (6-millimeter-) thick slices, cutting diagonally across the grain.

fields.name: Kugelhopf
fields.ingredient_amount: {'yeast-instant': ['instant yeast', '2 oz', 'yeast-instant'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '18 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 tsp', 'vanilla-extract'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '16 oz', 'eggs'], 'raisins-dark': ['dark raisins', '1 lb', 'raisins-dark'], 'milk': ['milk', '10 fl oz', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt', '3/4 oz', 'salt'], 'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '2, 2 lb', 'flour-bread'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '5 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: In a mixer fitted with the paddle, combine the milk, yeast, eggs and vanilla. Add the bread flour, sugar and salt. Mix on medium speed until well blended. Switch to the dough hook. Knead until the ingredients are thoroughly mixed and the dough is soft and smooth. Gradually add the butter, kneading until the dough is smooth. Add the rai-sins and gently mix them into the dough. Ferment the dough, covered until doubled, approximately 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Punch down the dough and let it bench rest for 15 minutes, covered. Divide the dough into four equal pieces. Round the dough and place each piece into a but-tered kugelhopf mold. Proof until the loaves have gained 70% in volume, approximately 1 hour. Bake at 350F (175C) for approximately 45 minutes. If the loaves brown too quickly, cover them with lightly buttered aluminum foil. Cool the loaves in the pans for approximately 30 minutes before unmolding to prevent col-lapsing.

fields.name: Watermelon and Cherry Salad with Fresh Mint Syrup
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mint-fresh': ['fresh mintas needed', '', 'mint-fresh'], 'water': ['water', '8 fl oz', 'water'], 'cherries-dark': ['dark cherries', '2 lb', 'cherries-dark'], 'watermelon-seedless': ['seedless watermelon', '3 lb', 'watermelon-seedless'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '3 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Pick the mint leaves and wash them. Bring the water to a boil in a small saucepan. Blanch the mint leaves in the water for 20 sec-onds. Remove the leaves and refresh them in cold water. Reserve the blanching water. Add the sugar to the blanching water, bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Drain the mint leaves. Squeeze all of the water out of them and chop them finely. Add the chopped mint to the sugar syrup. Refrigerate the syrup until cold. Dice the watermelon or scoop balls from it with a melon ball cutter. Combine the watermelon with the pitted cherries in a stainless bowl. Pour the mint syrup over the fruit and toss gently. Serve garnished with sprigs of fresh mint.

fields.name: Espagnole (Brown Sauce)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '2 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'brown-stock': ['Brown Stock', '5 qt', 'brown-stock'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/4 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'tomato-pura-e': ['tomato purÃ©e', '8 oz', 'tomato-pura-e'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '8 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '8 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '8 fl oz', 'clarified-butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Saut the mirepoix in the butter until well caramelized. Add the flour and cook to make a brown roux. Add the stock and tomato pure. Stir to break up any lumps of roux. Bring to a boil; reduce to a simmer. Add the sachet. Simmer for approximately 112 hours, allowing the sauce to reduce. Skim the surface as needed to remove impurities. Strain the sauce through a china cap lined with several layers of cheesecloth. Adjust season-ings and cool in a water bath or hold for service.

fields.name: Fresh Cranberry-Orange Relish
fields.ingredient_amount: {'orange-segments': ['Orange Segments', '20 ea', 'orange-segments'], 'grand-marnier': ['grand marnier', '2 fl oz', 'grand-marnier'], 'orange-juice': ['orange juice', '4 fl oz', 'orange-juice'], 'orange-zest': ['Orange Zest', '2 tbl', 'orange-zest'], 'water': ['water', '4 fl oz', 'water'], 'cranberries': ['cranberries', '1, 8 lb', 'cranberries'], 'cinnamon-stick': ['cinnamon stick', '1 ea', 'cinnamon-stick'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Combine the sugar, orange juice and water in a nonreactive rondeau or saucepan; bring to a boil. Add the cranberries and cinnamon stick and simmer uncovered until the berries begin to burst, approximately 15 minutes. Skim off any foam that rises to the surface. Add the orange liqueur and zest and simmer for another 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and remove the cinnamon stick. Add the orange segments. Cool and refrigerate. Serve with roasted game, poultry or charcuterie items. VARIATION: Jalapeo-Cranberry RelishOmit the orange liqueur, zest and segments. Add 1 fresh jalapeo pepper, minced, and 12 cup (120 milliliters) hot pepper jelly.

fields.name: Veal Cutlets (4 oz)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'veal-top-round': ['veal top round', '6 lb', 'veal-top-round']}
fields.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim meat of all excess fat and sliverskin Using accurate scale - cut 4 oz cutlets Layout on paper-lined hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator."

fields.name: Baked Crme Brle
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vanilla-bean': ['vanilla bean', '1/2 ea', 'vanilla-bean'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 qt', 'cream-heavy'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '10 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugaras needed', '', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Heat the cream and the vanilla bean in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat until bub-bles appear along the sides of the pan. Quickly whisk the sugar into the egg yolks. When the cream is hot, slowly pour it into the yolk mixture. Whisk until well combined. Strain the mixture through a fine sieve into a pitcher or large measuring cup. Scrape the va-nilla bean with the tip of a paring knife to remove the remaining seeds; stir the seeds into the custard. Preheat the oven to 325F (160C). Arrange the ramekins in a 2-inch- (5-centimeter-) deep hotel pan or baking dish. Pour the custard into the ramekins. Set the pan of ramekins inside the preheated oven, then carefully pour enough water into the pan to come two-thirds of the way up the sides of the ramekins. Bake until just set, approximately 45 to 50 minutes. Start checking the custards early; baking time will depend on the thickness and depth of your ramekins. The custard should be set, not soupy, with only a small area of jiggle in the center. When the custards are done, carefully remove the baking dish from the oven and allow the ramekins to cool in the water bath. When the ramekins are cool enough to handle, remove them from the water, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to 2 days before service. At service, sprinkle the top of each custard with granulated sugar, then immediately caramel-ize the sugar with a propane torch or under a broiler.

fields.name: Creole Rmoulade
fields.ingredient_amount: {'onion-yellow': ['yellow onion', '1/2 cup', 'onion-yellow'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '1 tbl', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'water': ['water', '1 tsp', 'water'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustard', '3 tbl', 'mustard-dijon'], 'tabasco-sauce': ['tabasco sauce to taste', '', 'tabasco-sauce'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '12 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'ketchup': ['ketchup', '3 oz', 'ketchup'], 'anchovy-fillets': ['anchovy fillets', '3 ea', 'anchovy-fillets'], 'parsley-fresh-italian': ['fresh Italian parsley', '1/3 cup', 'parsley-fresh-italian'], 'egg-yolks-pasteurized': ['pasteurized egg yolks', '3 ea', 'egg-yolks-pasteurized'], 'worcestershire-sauce': ['worcestershire sauce', '1/2 tsp', 'worcestershire-sauce'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tbl', 'garlic'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'pepper-cayenne': ['cayenne pepper', '1/4 tsp', 'pepper-cayenne']}
fields.directions: Combine the egg yolks, salt and lemon juice in a mixing bowl or a food processor. While whisking, add the oil in drops to form an emulsion. When the mixture thickens, the remain-ing oil can be added in a slow, steady stream. Add the hot water and mix to lighten the may-onnaises color. Adjust the seasoning with salt, white pepper and additional lemon juice as necessary. Stir in the remaining ingredients by hand. If the sauce is too thick, thin it with 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) red wine vinegar into which 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) sugar has been dis-solved.

fields.name: Quiche Lorraine
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '4 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'cheese-swiss': ['Swiss cheese', '2 oz', 'cheese-swiss'], 'bacon': ['bacon', '4 oz', 'bacon'], 'nutmeg-ground': ['ground nutmeg to taste', '', 'nutmeg-ground'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '4 ea', 'eggs'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'milk': ['milk', '1 pt', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'flaky-pie-dough-shell': ['Flaky Pie Dough Shell', '1 ea', 'flaky-pie-dough-shell']}
fields.directions: Place the bacon and cheese in the pie shell. To make the custard, combine the eggs, milk and cream, and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Pour the custard over the bacon and cheese and bake at 350F (180C) until the custard is set and it reaches an internal temperature of 160F (71C), approximately 1 hour.

fields.name: Mignonette Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vinegar-red-wine': ['red wine vinegar', '1 pt', 'vinegar-red-wine'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '4 oz', 'shallot'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper', '2 tsp', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Combine all ingredients.

fields.name: Vegetable Stock
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '2 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'turnips-white': ['white turnips', '2 oz', 'turnips-white'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '4 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'water': ['water', '1 gal', 'water'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '2 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'wine-dry-white': ['dry white wine', '8 fl oz', 'wine-dry-white'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/4 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '8 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'leeks': ['leeks', '8 oz', 'leeks'], 'fennel-fresh': ['fresh fennel', '4 oz', 'fennel-fresh'], 'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '2 oz', 'tomatoes-fresh']}
fields.directions: Heat the oil. Add the mirepoix, leek, garlic, fennel, turnip and tomato and sweat for 10 minutes. Add the wine, water and sachet. Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes. Strain, cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: Coconut Pecan Frosting
fields.ingredient_amount: {'milk-evaporated': ['evaporated milk', '8 fl oz', 'milk-evaporated'], 'pecan-pieces': ['pecan pieces', '4 oz', 'pecan-pieces'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '8 oz', 'sugar-granulated'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '3 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '4 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'coconut-flaked': ['flaked coconut', '4 oz', 'coconut-flaked'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 tsp', 'vanilla-extract']}
fields.directions: Combine the milk, sugar, egg yolks and butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens, approximately 12 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the vanilla, coconut and pecans. Beat until cool and spreada-ble

fields.name: Pumpkin Muffins
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pumpkin-canned': ['canned pumpkin', '2 lb', 'pumpkin-canned'], 'baking-powder': ['baking powder', '1 tbl', 'baking-powder'], 'cinnamon-ground': ['ground cinnamon', '2 tsp', 'cinnamon-ground'], 'streusel-topping': ['Streusel Toppingas needed', '', 'streusel-topping'], 'cardamom-seed-ground': ['ground cardamom seed', '1/2 tsp', 'cardamom-seed-ground'], 'salt': ['salt', '2 1/2 tsp', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '8 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'cloves-ground': ['ground cloves', '1 tsp', 'cloves-ground'], 'orange-juice': ['orange juice', '12 fl oz', 'orange-juice'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '8 ea', 'eggs'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '1, 10 lb', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'ginger-ground': ['ground ginger', '2 tsp', 'ginger-ground'], 'baking-soda': ['baking soda', '1 1/2 tsp', 'baking-soda'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '2, 10 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Sift together the dry ingredients and set aside. Whip the eggs in a mixer fitted with the whip attachment until well beaten. Add the sugar, oil and salt and whip for 5 minutes on medium speed. Add the pumpkin pure and mix until combined. Add the dry ingredients and mix until well blended. Pour in the orange juice and mix until smooth. Scale the batter into greased and paper-lined muffin tins or paper baking cups approximately three-quarters full. Sprinkle with streusel, if using. Bake at 400F (200C) until the muffins bounce back when lightly pressed, approximately 18 to 22 minutes.

fields.name: Boeuf  la Ficelle (Beef Poached on a String)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'potato-white': ['white potato', '16 ea', 'potato-white'], 'celery': ['celery', '16 ea', 'celery'], 'wine-white': ['white wine', '1 fl oz', 'wine-white'], 'mushrooms-medium': ['medium mushrooms', '24 ea', 'mushrooms-medium'], 'beef-tenderloin-center-cut': ['center cut beef tenderloin', '3 lb', 'beef-tenderloin-center-cut'], 'white-veal-stock': ['White Veal Stock', '3 qt', 'white-veal-stock'], 'turnips-baby': ['baby turnips', '16 ea', 'turnips-baby'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'carrot': ['carrot', '1 ea', 'carrot'], 'wine-port': ['port wine', '1 fl oz', 'wine-port'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1 sprig', 'thyme-fresh'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustardas needed', '', 'mustard-dijon'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '3 tbl', 'butter'], 'chives-fresh': ['fresh chives', '2 tsp', 'chives-fresh'], 'leeks': ['leeks', '1 ea', 'leeks'], 'onion-pearl': ['pearl onion', '16 ea', 'onion-pearl']}
fields.directions: Tie the tenderloins, leaving long strings on each end. Place the white wine, carrots, baby turnips, pearl onions, celery, mushroom caps, potatoes and bouquet garni in a 6-quart (6-liter) saucepot. Add the stock, bring to a simmer and cook 5 minutes. Add the tenderloins to the stock and vegetables, tying the long strings to the handles of the pot so the meat is fully submerged and is not sitting on the bottom. Reduce the heat and poach the tenderloins for 15 to 20 minutes or until rare. Remove the tenderloins from the cooking liquid and remove the string. Simmer the vegeta-bles in the cooking liquid until done and remove with a slotted spoon. Reduce the cooking liquid to concentrate its flavor as desired. Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper and add the port wine. Mont au beurre. Slice the tenderloin and present on plates or platters with the vegetables. Immediately before serving, ladle a portion of the hot broth over the tenderloin and vegetables. Garnish with chives. Serve additional broth and mustard separately.

fields.name: Pork Stock
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '2 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'water': ['water', '3 gal', 'water'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pork-chop-8-oz': ['pork chop 8 oz', '1 lb', 'pork-chop-8-oz'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '8 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'pork-bones': ['pork bones', '15 lb', 'pork-bones']}
fields.directions: Cut the washed bones into pieces approximately 34 inches (810 centimeters) long. Place the bones in a stockpot and cover them with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: Foyot Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'ba-arnaise': ['BÃ©arnaise', '1 qt', 'ba-arnaise'], 'glace-de-viande': ['Glace de Viande', '3 fl oz', 'glace-de-viande']}
fields.directions: Add to barnaise 3 fluid ounces (90 milliliters) melted glace de viande.

fields.name: Soubise Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'ba-chamel': ['BÃ©chamel', '1 qt', 'ba-chamel'], 'butter': ['butter', '1 oz', 'butter'], 'onion': ['onion', '1 lb', 'onion'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Sweat 1 pound (480 grams) diced onions in 1 ounce (30 grams) whole butter without browning. Add bchamel and simmer until the onions are fully cooked. Strain through a fine chinois.

fields.name: Chicken Soup With Matzo Balls
fields.ingredient_amount: {'chicken-whole-3-lb-up': ['whole 3 lb up chicken', '3 ea', 'chicken-whole-3-lb-up'], 'matzo-balls': ['Matzo Ballsas needed', '', 'matzo-balls'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '10 qt', 'chicken-stock'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsleyas needed', '', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '1 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Simmer the chicken in the stock for 2 hours, skimming as necessary. Add the mirepoix and sachet. Simmer for another hour. Strain and degrease the broth. Adjust seasonings. Bring to a boil at service time. Portion into heated bowls and garnish with chopped parsley and one or two Matzo Balls.

fields.name: clair Shells (baked)
fields.directions: Directions:

fields.name: Dark Chocolate Syrup
fields.ingredient_amount: {'water': ['water', '12 fl oz', 'water'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '2 tbl', 'cream-heavy'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '3 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'cocoa-powder': ['cocoa powder', '2 oz', 'cocoa-powder'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '8 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Mix the cocoa powder with just enough of the water to make a smooth paste. Bring the sugar and remaining water to a boil in a small, heavy saucepan. Immediately add the cocoa paste, whisking until smooth. Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring constantly, then remove from the heat. Stir the butter and cream into the warm cocoa mixture. Serve warm or at room temperature.

fields.name: Cream Cheese Frosting
fields.ingredient_amount: {'sugar-confectioners': ['confectioners sugar', '3 lb', 'sugar-confectioners'], 'margarine-unsalted': ['unsalted margarine', '6 oz', 'margarine-unsalted'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 tbl', 'vanilla-extract'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '6 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'cheese-cream': ['cream cheese', '1, 8 lb', 'cheese-cream']}
fields.directions: Cream the butter and cream cheese until smooth. Add the margarine and beat well. Beat in the vanilla. Slowly add the sugar, scraping down the bowl frequently. Beat until smooth.

fields.name: Robert Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'wine-dry-white': ['dry white wine', '8 fl oz', 'wine-dry-white'], 'onion': ['onion', '8 oz', 'onion'], 'demi-glace': ['Demi-Glace', '1 qt', 'demi-glace'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustard', '2 tsp', 'mustard-dijon'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '1 oz', 'butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1 tbl', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Saut 8 ounces (240 grams) chopped onion in 1 ounce (30 grams) whole butter. Add 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) dry white wine and reduce by two-thirds. Add demi-glace and simmer for 10 minutes. Strain and then add 2 teaspoons (10 milliliters) prepared Dijon mustard and 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) granulated sugar. If the finished Robert sauce is garnished with sliced sour pickles, preferably cornichons, it is known as Charcutire. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Rabbit Stock
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '2 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'water': ['water', '3 gal', 'water'], 'rabbit-whole-fryer': ['whole fryer rabbit', '15 lb', 'rabbit-whole-fryer'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '8 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole']}
fields.directions: Cut the rabbit into pieces. Place in a stockpot and cover with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: Achiote Paste
fields.ingredient_amount: {'annatto-seed': ['annatto seed', '1 tsp', 'annatto-seed'], 'allspice-ground': ['ground allspice', '1/4 tsp', 'allspice-ground'], 'pepper-ancho-chile': ['ancho chile pepper', '3 ea', 'pepper-ancho-chile'], 'orange-juice': ['orange juice', '2 fl oz', 'orange-juice'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt', '1/2 tsp', 'salt-kosher'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '1 tsp', 'oil-olive'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '1 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'cumin-whole': ['whole cumin', '1/2 tsp', 'cumin-whole'], 'vinegar-white-wine': ['white wine vinegar', '1 fl oz', 'vinegar-white-wine']}
fields.directions: 1 Toast the ancho chiles in a skillet over medium heat for 2 minutes, or until they release some oil and have a toasted aroma. Let cool slightly, then core, seed and tear into strips. 2 Place the ancho strips in a blender with the remaining ingredients and pure until smooth.

fields.name: Montpelier Butter
fields.ingredient_amount: {'chervil-fresh': ['fresh chervil', '1 oz', 'chervil-fresh'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'watercress': ['watercress', '1 oz', 'watercress'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '2 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '1 oz', 'parsley-fresh'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '2 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 lb', 'butter-unsalted'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'tarragon-fresh': ['fresh tarragon', '1 oz', 'tarragon-fresh']}
fields.directions: Blanch 1 ounce (30 grams) fresh parsley, 1 ounce (30 grams) fresh chervil, 1 ounce (30 grams) watercress and 1 ounce (30 grams) fresh tarragon in boiling water. Drain thoroughly. Mince 2 hard-boiled egg yolks, 2 garlic cloves and 2 sour gherkin pickles. Blend everything into the butter.

fields.name: Roux
fields.ingredient_amount: {'butter': ['butter', '1 lb', 'butter'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '1 lb', 'flour-all-purpose']}
fields.directions: ROUX  Roux (roo) is the principal means used to thicken sauces. It is a combination of equal parts, by weight, of flour and fat, cooked together to form a paste. Cooking the flour in fat coats the starch granules with the fat and prevents them from lumping together or forming lumps when introduced into a liquid. In large production kitchens, large amounts of roux are prepared and held for use as needed. Smaller operations may make roux as required for each recipe.

fields.name: Beet Vinaigrette
fields.ingredient_amount: {'wine-white': ['white wine', '4 fl oz', 'wine-white'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '2 tbl', 'shallot'], 'water': ['water', '1 fl oz', 'water'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '10 ea', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'cornstarch': ['cornstarch', '2 tbl', 'cornstarch'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'poultry-demi-glace': ['Poultry Demi-Glace', '4 fl oz', 'poultry-demi-glace'], 'beet-juice': ['beet juice', '3 pt', 'beet-juice'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1 bunch', 'thyme-fresh'], 'horseradish-fresh': ['fresh horseradish', '3 tbl', 'horseradish-fresh'], 'vinegar-cider': ['cider vinegar', '8 fl oz', 'vinegar-cider'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tbl', 'garlic']}
fields.directions: Combine the beet juice, horseradish, shallot, garlic, thyme and black peppercorns. Reduce to 1 1/2 pints (720 milliliters). Add the vinegar, wine and demi-glace; simmer for 20 minutes. Combine the cornstarch and water until smooth. Whisk the slurry into the sauce and bring to a boil. Strain through a fine-mesh china cap and season  to taste.

fields.name: Veal Marengo
fields.ingredient_amount: {'brown-veal-stock': ['Brown Veal Stock', '1 pt', 'brown-veal-stock'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '1 1/2 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'mushrooms-medium': ['medium mushrooms', '8 oz', 'mushrooms-medium'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '2 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'onion-pearl': ['pearl onion', '24 ea', 'onion-pearl'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'carrot': ['carrot', '1 ea', 'carrot'], 'veal-lean-boneless': ['lean boneless veal', '2, 8 lb', 'veal-lean-boneless'], 'wine-dry-white': ['dry white wine', '6 fl oz', 'wine-dry-white'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'rice-pilaf': ['Rice Pilafas needed', '', 'rice-pilaf'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1 sprig', 'thyme-fresh'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'onion': ['onion', '12 oz', 'onion'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '2 tbl', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'leeks': ['leeks', '1 ea', 'leeks'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '3 fl oz', 'clarified-butter'], 'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '1 lb', 'tomatoes-fresh'], 'tomato-paste': ['tomato paste', '1 oz', 'tomato-paste']}
fields.directions: Season the veal cubes with salt and pepper and dredge in flour. Heat a heavy-bottomed 8-quart (8-liter) sauce pan over moderate heat. Add 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) oil and 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) clarified butter to the pan. Add the veal and cook, browning well on all sides. Remove and set aside. Add 112 fluid ounces (45 milliliters) clarified butter and saut the onions, carrots and garlic without coloring. Stir in the tomato paste and return the veal to the pan. Sprinkle with 2 ta-blespoons (30 milliliters) flour and cook to make a roux. Add the wine, stock and bouquet garni to the pan; bring to a boil. Cover and simmer until the meat is tender, approximately 112 hours. Saut the mushrooms until dry in the remaining oil and butter without browning. Add the tomatoes to the pan and saut over high heat for 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Re-move from the heat and reserve. When the veal is tender, remove it from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside. Strain the sauce. Return the sauce to the pan and bring it to a boil. The sauce should be the consistency of a light cream sauce. Adjust the consistency of the sauce by reducing it on the stove top or by adding additional brown veal stock. Return the veal to the sauce along with the mushrooms, tomatoes and pearl onions. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Adjust the seasonings. Serve plated with timbales of rice pilaf.

fields.name: Madeira Aspic
fields.ingredient_amount: {'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '1 1/2 gal', 'chicken-stock'], 'gelatin-powdered': ['powdered gelatin', '6 oz', 'gelatin-powdered'], 'wine-madeira': ['Madeira wine to taste', '', 'wine-madeira']}
fields.directions: Make 1 gallon of Chicken Consomm from Chicken Stock. Dissolve the gelatin in the hot consomm and stir in the Madeira. Pour into clean hotel pan to chill and set.

fields.name: Toffee Caramel Flan
fields.ingredient_amount: {'sugar-light-brown': ['light brown sugar', '6 oz', 'sugar-light-brown'], 'vanilla-bean': ['vanilla bean', '1 ea', 'vanilla-bean'], 'molasses': ['molasses', '1 tbl', 'molasses'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '24 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '8 ea', 'eggs'], 'water': ['water', '8 fl oz', 'water'], 'amaretto': ['amaretto', '2 tbl', 'amaretto'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '4 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'milk': ['milk', '24 fl oz', 'milk'], 'cinnamon-stick': ['cinnamon stick', '2 ea', 'cinnamon-stick'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1, 4 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Combine the granulated sugar with the water in a small heavy saucepan; bring to a boil. Cook until the sugar reaches a deep golden brown. Immediately pour about 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) caramelized sugar into each ramekin. Tilt each ramekin to spread the caramel evenly along the bottom. Arrange the ramekins in a 2-inch- (5-centimeter-) deep hotel pan and set aside. Combine the milk, cream, cinnamon sticks and vanilla bean in a large saucepan. Bring just to a boil, cover and remove from the heat. Allow this mixture to steep for about 30 minutes. Whisk the eggs, egg yolks, brown sugar, molasses and amaretto together in a large bowl. Uncover the milk mixture and return it to the stove top. Bring just to a boil. Temper the egg-and-sugar mixture with approximately one-third of the hot milk. Whisk in the remaining hot milk. Strain the custard through a fine mesh strainer. Pour into the caramel-lined ramekins, filling to just below the rim. Pour enough warm water into the hotel pan to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake at 325F (160C) for approximately 30 to 40 minutes. The custards should be almost set, but still slightly soft in the center. Completely chill the baked custards before serving. To unmold, run a small knife around the edge of the custard, invert onto the serving plate and give the ramekin a firm sideways shake. Garnish with fresh fruit or caramelized almonds.

fields.name: Herb Mayonnaise
fields.ingredient_amount: {'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '1 tsp', 'parsley-fresh'], 'basil-fresh': ['fresh basil', '1 tbl', 'basil-fresh'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '1 tsp', 'cilantro-fresh'], 'mayonnaise': ['mayonnaise', '8 fl oz', 'mayonnaise']}
fields.directions: 1 Stir all the ingredients together until the herbs are evenly distributed throughout the mayon-naise. Chill until ready to use.

fields.name: Royal Icing
fields.ingredient_amount: {'egg-whites-pasteurized': ['pasteurized egg whites', '1 ea', 'egg-whites-pasteurized'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '1/4 tsp', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'sugar-confectioners': ['confectioners sugar', '6 oz', 'sugar-confectioners']}
fields.directions: Sift the sugar and set aside. Place the egg white and lemon juice in a stainless steel bowl. Add 4 ounces (120 grams) sugar and beat with an electric mixer or metal spoon until blended. The mixture should fall from a spoon in heavy globs. If it pours, it is too thin and will need the remaining 2 ounces (60 grams) sugar. Once the consistency is correct, continue beating for 3 to 4 minutes. The icing should be white, smooth and thick enough to hold a stiff peak. Food coloring paste can be added at this time if desired. Cover the icing with a damp towel and plastic wrap to prevent it from hardening. Royal icing will keep refrigerated for 1 to 2 days.

fields.name: Tomato Concass
fields.ingredient_amount: {'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '6 ea', 'tomatoes-fresh']}
fields.directions: With a paring knife, mark an x on the bottom of the tomato just deep enough to penetrate the skin. Blanch the tomato in boiling water for 20 seconds,refresh in ice water. Using a paring knife, cut out the core and peel the tomato. Cut the tomato in half horizontally and squeeze out the seeds and juice. Chop or dice the tomato as desired for the recipe.

fields.name: Danish Pastries
fields.ingredient_amount: {'yeast-dry-active': ['dry active yeast', '1/2 oz', 'yeast-dry-active'], 'egg-wash': ['Egg Washas needed', '', 'egg-wash'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '1, 4 lb', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 tsp', 'vanilla-extract'], 'cinnamon-ground': ['ground cinnamon', '1/2 tsp', 'cinnamon-ground'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '2 ea', 'eggs'], 'water': ['water', '4 fl oz', 'water'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 lb', 'butter-unsalted'], 'milk': ['milk', '4 fl oz', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tsp', 'salt'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '4 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: In a large bowl, stir together the yeast and 12 ounces (360 grams) flour. Add the sugar, water, milk, eggs, salt, vanilla, cinnamon and melted butter. Stir until well combined. Add the remaining flour gradually, kneading the dough by hand or with a mixer fitted with a dough hook. Knead until the dough is smooth and only slightly tacky to the touch, approximately 2 to 3 minutes. Place the dough in a bowl that has been lightly dusted with flour. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Prepare the remaining butter while the dough is chilling. Start by sprinkling flour over the work surface and placing the cold butter on the flour. Then pound the butter with a rolling pin until the butter softens. Using a pastry scraper or the heel of your hand, knead the butter and flour until the mixture is spreadable. The butter should still be cold. If it begins to melt, refrigerate it until firm. Keep the butter chilled until the dough is ready. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough into a large rectangle, about 1/2 inch (1.2 centimeters) thick. Brush away any excess flour. Spread the chilled butter evenly over two-thirds of the dough. Fold the unbuttered third over the center, then fold the buttered third over the top. Press the edges together to seal in the butter. Roll the dough into a rectangle about 12 inches X 18 inches (30 centimeters X 45 centimeters). Fold the dough in thirds as before. This rolling and folding (called a turn) must be done a total of six times. Chill the dough between turns as necessary. After the final turn, wrap the dough well and retard for at least 4 hours or overnight. Shape and fill the Danish dough as desired. Place the shaped pastries on a paper-lined baking sheet and proof for approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Brush the pastries with egg wash and sprinkle lightly with sugar if desired. Bake at 400F (200C) for 5 minutes. Decrease the oven temperature to 350F (180C) and bake until light brown, approximately 12 to 15 minutes.

fields.name: Cream Of Broccoli Soup
fields.ingredient_amount: {'chicken-velouta': ['Chicken VeloutÃ©', '4 qt', 'chicken-velouta'], 'celery': ['celery', '3 oz', 'celery'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '24 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'onion': ['onion', '12 oz', 'onion'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '2 qt', 'chicken-stock'], 'broccoli': ['broccoli', '3 lb', 'broccoli'], 'butter': ['butter', '3 oz', 'butter'], 'broccoli-florets': ['broccoli florets', '8 oz', 'broccoli-florets'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Sweat the onions, celery and broccoli in the butter, without browning, until they are nearly tender. Add the velout sauce. Bring to a simmer and cook until the vegetables are tender, approxi-mately 15 minutes. Skim the surface periodically. Pure the soup, then strain it through a china cap. Return the soup to the stove and thin it to the correct consistency with the stock. Bring the soup to a simmer and add the cream. Season  to taste. Garnish with blanched broccoli florets just before service. VARIATIONS: To make cream of asparagus, cauliflower, corn, pea or spinach soup, substitute an equal amount of the chosen vegetable for the broccoli. If using fresh spinach, precook the leaves slightly before proceeding with the recipe.

fields.name: Port Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'wine-port': ['port wine', '4 fl oz', 'wine-port'], 'demi-glace': ['Demi-Glace', '1 qt', 'demi-glace'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Bring demi-glace to a boil and reduce slightly. Then add 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) Port wine. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Bacon Lardons
fields.ingredient_amount: {'bacon': ['bacon', '1 lb', 'bacon']}
fields.directions: Cut into bacon into 1/2" pieces. Set a saute pan over medium heat - add bacon. Cook, stirring frequently until most of the fat has rendered and the bacon is crispy, about 6 - 8 minutes. Remove lardons with a slotted spoon and place on paper towel.

fields.name: Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lemon-zest': ['Lemon Zest', '1 tbl', 'lemon-zest'], 'baking-powder': ['baking powder', '1 tbl', 'baking-powder'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '4 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'sugar-confectioners': ['confectioners sugaras needed', '', 'sugar-confectioners'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '12 ea', 'eggs'], 'salt': ['salt', '2 tsp', 'salt'], 'cream-sour': ['sour cream', '1 pt', 'cream-sour'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 fl oz', 'vanilla-extract'], 'poppy-seed': ['poppy seed', '3 oz', 'poppy-seed'], 'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '8 oz', 'flour-bread'], 'flour-pastry': ['pastry flour', '2 lb', 'flour-pastry'], 'honey': ['honey', '4 fl oz', 'honey'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 lb', 'butter-unsalted'], 'baking-soda': ['baking soda', '1 tsp', 'baking-soda'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1, 10 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Sift together the flours, baking soda and baking powder. Stir in the poppy seeds and set aside. Using a mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter until lump-free and fluffy. Add the sugar, glucose or honey and oil and blend until light. Gradually add the eggs followed by the salt, vanilla extract, lemon zest and sour cream. Then stir in the sifted dry ingredients. Portion the batter into 5-ounce (150-gram) portions using a scale or #6 scoop and place in greased or paper-lined muffin tins. Bake at 425F (220C) until the centers of the muffins bounce back when lightly pressed, ap-proximately 15 to 18 minutes. Dust muffins with powdered sugar.

fields.name: Hollandaise
fields.ingredient_amount: {'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-whole-white': ['whole white pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-white'], 'vinegar-white-wine': ['white wine vinegar', '3 fl oz', 'vinegar-white-wine'], 'water': ['water', '2 fl oz', 'water'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '1.5 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'egg-yolks-pasteurized': ['pasteurized egg yolks', '6 ea', 'egg-yolks-pasteurized'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '1 pt', 'clarified-butter'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'pepper-cayenne': ['cayenne pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-cayenne']}
fields.directions: Combine the peppercorns, vinegar and water in a small saucepan and reduce by one-half. Place the egg yolks in a stainless steel bowl. Strain the vinegar-and-pepper reduction through a chinois into the yolks. There should be 12 fluid ounce (15 milliliters) acidic reduction for each egg yolk used. Place the bowl over a double boiler, whipping the mixture continuously with a wire whip. As the yolks cook, the mixture will thicken. When the mixture is thick enough to leave a trail across the surface when the whip is drawn away, remove the bowl from the double boiler. Do not overcook the egg yolks. Whip in 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) lemon juice to stop the yolks from cooking. Begin to add the warm clarified butter to the egg yolk mixture a few drops at a time, while constantly whipping the mixture to form an emulsion. Once the emulsion is started, the butter may be added more quickly. Continue until all the butter is incorporated. Whip in the remaining lemon juice. Adjust the seasonings. Strain the sauce through cheesecloth if necessary and hold for service in a warm (not simmer-ing) bain marie. This sauce may be held for approximately 1 to 112 hours.

fields.name: White Stock
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '2 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'water': ['water', '3 gal', 'water'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '8 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'chicken-backs-and-necks': ['chicken backs and necks', '15 lb', 'chicken-backs-and-necks']}
fields.directions: Cut the washed bones into pieces approximately 34 inches (810 centimeters) long. Place the bones in a stockpot and cover them with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: Lemon Rind
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lemon': ['lemon', '1 ea', 'lemon']}
fields.directions: Wash lemon.                                                                                          2) Peel yellow rind, avoiding white pith.                                         3) Dice or julienne with sharp knife

fields.name: Orange Zest
fields.ingredient_amount: {'oranges': ['oranges', '1 ea', 'oranges']}
fields.directions: Wash orange Zest orange part of rind, avoiding white pith.

fields.name: Veal Velout
fields.ingredient_amount: {'butter': ['butter', '8 fl oz', 'butter'], 'veal-stock': ['Veal Stock', '5 qt', 'veal-stock'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '8 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Heat the butter in a heavy saucepan. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Gradually add the stock to the roux, stirring constantly with a whisk to prevent lumps. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. (Seasonings are optional; their use depends on the season-ings in the stock and the sauces intended use.) Simmer and reduce to 1 gallon (3.8 liters), approximately 30 minutes. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth. Melted butter may be carefully ladled over the surface of the sauce to prevent a skin from forming. Hold for service or cool in a water bath.

fields.name: Matzo Balls
fields.ingredient_amount: {'chicken-fat': ['chicken fat', '2 oz', 'chicken-fat'], 'matzo-meal': ['matzo meal', '4 oz', 'matzo-meal'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '4 ea', 'eggs'], 'water': ['water', '2 fl oz', 'water'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Beat the eggsssss with the water. Stir in the fat or butter. Add matzo meal, salt and white pepper. The batter should be as thick as mashed potatoes. Chill for at least 1 hour. Bring 2 quarts (2 liters) water to a gentle boil. Using a #70 portion scoop, shape the batter into balls. Carefully drop each ball into the hot water. Cover and simmer until fully cooked, approximately 30 minutes. Remove the matzo balls from the water and serve in hot chicken soup.

fields.name: Caesar Dressing
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vinegar-balsamic': ['balsamic vinegar', '2 fl oz', 'vinegar-balsamic'], 'mustard-whole-grain': ['whole grain mustard', '1 tbl', 'mustard-whole-grain'], 'cheese-parmesan': ['parmesan cheese', '4 oz', 'cheese-parmesan'], 'vinegar-red-wine': ['red wine vinegar', '2 fl oz', 'vinegar-red-wine'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '12 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'eggs-pasteurized': ['pasteurized eggs', '2 ea', 'eggs-pasteurized'], 'oil-extra-virgin-olive': ['extra virgin olive oil', '12 fl oz', 'oil-extra-virgin-olive'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tbl', 'garlic'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'anchovy-fillets': ['anchovy fillets', '1 oz', 'anchovy-fillets'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustard', '1 tbl', 'mustard-dijon']}
fields.directions: 1 Combine the garlic, eggs, Parmesan, vinegars, mustards, anchovies, salt and pepper in the bowl of a food processor and process until smooth, approximately 1 minute. 2 With the machine running slowly, begin adding the oils to form an emulsion. 3 Continue until all the oil is incorporated.

fields.name: French or Italian Bread
fields.ingredient_amount: {'yeast-dry-active': ['dry active yeast', '1 oz', 'yeast-dry-active'], 'water': ['water', '39 fl oz', 'water'], 'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '3, 12 lb', 'flour-bread'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 1/4 oz', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Combine the water and yeast in a mixer bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and mix on low speed with a dough hook until all the flour is incorporated. Increase to medium speed and knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic. Let the dough ferment until doubled. Punch down, divide, shape and score as desired. Proof the loaves until doubled. Bake at 400F (200C) with steam during the first few minutes of baking, until the crust is well developed and golden brown and the bread is baked through, approximately 12 minutes for rolls and 20 minutes for small loaves.

fields.name: Pinto Beans
fields.ingredient_amount: {'water': ['wateras needed', '', 'water'], 'onion': ['onion', '6 oz', 'onion'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 1/2 tsp', 'salt'], 'beans-pinto': ['pinto beans', '1 lb', 'beans-pinto'], 'pepper-jalapeno-chile': ['jalapeno chile pepper', '1 ea', 'pepper-jalapeno-chile']}
fields.directions: 1 Soak the pinto beans in water for several hours and then drain them. Put them in a saucepan and add enough cold water to cover them thoroughly. Pierce the jalapeo several times with a paring knife and add it to the beans. Bring the beans to a boil, add the onion, cover and re-duce to a simmer. 2 Adding enough water to keep the beans barely covered, allow the beans to simmer until they are tender but not mushy, approximately 45 minutes. When the beans are nearly done, allow the liquid to reduce slightly and thicken into a sauce. 3 Season the beans  to taste with salt and discard the jalapeo

fields.name: Smoked Tomato Coulis
fields.ingredient_amount: {'wine-white': ['white wine', '6 fl oz', 'wine-white'], 'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '3 ea', 'tomatoes-fresh'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '3 tbl', 'oil-olive'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tsp', 'garlic'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'vegetable-stock': ['Vegetable Stock', '12 fl oz', 'vegetable-stock'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '1 tbl', 'shallot']}
fields.directions: 1 Cut the tomatoes in half. Smoke them with apple wood chips at 200F (90C) for 1 hour. 2 In a medium saucepot, saut the garlic and shallots in the oil until translucent. Deglaze with the wine and reduce by half. Roughly chop the tomatoes and add them to the pot. Add the stock. Simmer for 25 minutes. Pure the sauce and strain through a fine chinois. Adjust the seasonings.

fields.name: Hot Bacon Vinaigrette
fields.ingredient_amount: {'oil-corn': ['corn oil', '1 pt', 'oil-corn'], 'bacon': ['bacon', '10 slice', 'bacon'], 'marjoram-fresh': ['fresh marjoram', '1/4 oz', 'marjoram-fresh'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1 tbl', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'chives-fresh': ['fresh chives', '1/2 oz', 'chives-fresh'], 'basil-fresh': ['fresh basil', '1/2 oz', 'basil-fresh'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt', '1 tsp', 'salt-kosher']}
fields.directions: 1 Dice the bacon. In a heavy saucepan, combine the bacon and oil and cook until the bacon is crisp. Allow the bacon and oil to cool. 2 Whisk the herbs into the oil. Whisk in the vinegar and season with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Biscuit Dough
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '2, 8 lb', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'baking-powder': ['baking powder', '2 oz', 'baking-powder'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '14 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'milk': ['milk', '24 fl oz', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt', '3/4 oz', 'salt'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '2 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: 1. Sift the dry ingredients together, making sure they are blended thoroughly. 2. Cut in the butter. The mixture should look mealy; do not overmix. 3. Add the milk and stir, combining only until the mixture holds together. 4. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface; knead until it forms one mass, approxi-mately five or six kneadings. 5. Roll out the dough to a thickness of 1/2 inch (1.2 centimeters). Cut with a floured cutter into desired size.

fields.name: Rice Pilaf
fields.ingredient_amount: {'rice-converted': ['converted rice', '1 cup', 'rice-converted'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '1 fl oz', 'clarified-butter'], 'onion': ['onion', '3 oz', 'onion'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Place the stock in a saucepot, bring to a boil, and reduce to a simmer. Heat the butter in a second saucepot, add the onion, and sweat over medium heat until the onion begins to soften and become translucent, but not brown. Add the rice and stir until well coated with butter. Add the stock and bay leaf to the rice. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook over low heat for 18 to 20 minutes. Alternatively, place the rice in a 350F (177C) oven for about 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and reserve in a warm place for 5 minutes. Before service, fluff up the rice with a fork, discard the bay leaf, and serve hot. Variation for Brown Rice Pilaf The process is the same for brown rice except for the following: Increase the amount of chicken stock to 20 ounces (600 milliliters). Increase the cooking time to 30 minutes, or until the water is absorbed. NOTE: Rice is measured by volume rather than by weight. The proportion is typically 1 part rice to 2 parts liquid. Many chefs measure the amount of stock they prepare this dish with by using between 1 1/2 and 2 times the volume of stock to rice.

fields.name: Tamarind Glaze
fields.ingredient_amount: {'sugar-light-brown': ['light brown sugar', '8 oz', 'sugar-light-brown'], 'tamarind-paste': ['tamarind paste', '11 oz', 'tamarind-paste'], 'ginger-fresh': ['fresh ginger', '1 tbl', 'ginger-fresh']}
fields.directions: 1 Combine the ingredients and simmer until thick. Strain through a china cap.

fields.name: Creole Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'celery': ['celery', '4 oz', 'celery'], 'onion': ['onion', '6 oz', 'onion'], 'pepper-green-bell': ['green bell pepper', '4 oz', 'pepper-green-bell'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '1 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'tomato-sauce': ['Tomato Sauce', '1 qt', 'tomato-sauce'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tsp', 'garlic'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1 pinch', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'hot-sauce-louisiana': ['Louisiana hot sauce', '1 pinch', 'hot-sauce-louisiana']}
fields.directions: Saut 6 ounces (180 grams) finely diced onion, 4 ounces (120 grams) thinly sliced celery and 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) garlic in 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) oil. Add tomato sauce, a bay leaf and 1 pinch thyme; simmer for 15 minutes. Then add 4 ounces (120 grams) finely diced green pepper and a dash of hot pepper sauce; simmer for 15 minutes longer. Remove the bay leaf. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Glace de Poisson
fields.ingredient_amount: {'fish-stock': ['Fish Stock', '1 gal', 'fish-stock']}
fields.directions: Simmer the stock over very low heat. Be careful not to let it burn, and skim it often. As it reduces and the volume decreases, transfer the liquid into progressively smaller sauce-pans. Strain the liquid each time it is transferred into a smaller saucepan. Strain it a final time, cool and refrigerate. A properly made glaze will keep for several months under refrigeration.

fields.name: Tricolor Bean Salad
fields.ingredient_amount: {'peas-dried-black-eyed': ['dried black-eyed peas', '4 oz', 'peas-dried-black-eyed'], 'tomatoes-plum': ['plum tomatoes', '3 ea', 'tomatoes-plum'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '3 tbl', 'oil-olive'], 'beans-black': ['black beans', '4 oz', 'beans-black'], 'vinegar-red-wine': ['red wine vinegar', '1 fl oz', 'vinegar-red-wine'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'onion-red': ['red onion', '1 oz', 'onion-red'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustard', '2 tbl', 'mustard-dijon'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '1 bunch', 'cilantro-fresh'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tsp', 'garlic'], 'pepper-jalapeno-chile': ['jalapeno chile pepper', '2 ea', 'pepper-jalapeno-chile']}
fields.directions: 1 Combine the mustard, garlic, onion, jalapeos and vinegar in a mixing bowl. 2 Slowly whisk in the oil in a steady stream. 3 Add the beans, black-eyed peas, tomato concasse and cilantro and season with salt and pep-per. Refrigerate 1 hour to allow the flavors to blend.

fields.name: Candied Almonds
fields.ingredient_amount: {'almonds-sliced': ['sliced almonds', '8 oz', 'almonds-sliced'], 'egg-whites': ['egg whites', '2 oz', 'egg-whites'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '2 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: MISE EN PLACE  Preheat oven to 325F (160C).  Whisk the egg whites and sugar together. Add the almonds. Toss with a rubber spatula to coat the nuts completely.  Spread the nuts in a thin layer on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 325F (160C) until lightly toasted and dry, approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Watch closely to prevent burning.  Stir the nuts with a metal spatula every 5 to 7 minutes during baking.  Cool completely. Store in an airtight container up to 10 days.

fields.name: Beef Wellington
fields.ingredient_amount: {'egg-wash': ['Egg Washas needed', '', 'egg-wash'], 'beef-tenderloin': ['beef tenderloin', '4, 8 lb', 'beef-tenderloin'], 'truffle-peelings': ['truffle peelings', '1 oz', 'truffle-peelings'], 'foie-gras-pa-ta': ['foie gras pÃ¢tÃ©', '8 oz', 'foie-gras-pa-ta'], 'madeira-sauce': ['Madeira Sauce', '20 fl oz', 'madeira-sauce'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oilas needed', '', 'oil-vegetable'], 'puff-pastry': ['Puff Pastry', '2 lb', 'puff-pastry']}
fields.directions: Trim 3 to 4 inches (7.5 to 10 centimeters) of the tail from the tenderloin. (The small tail por-tion can be used for some other preparation.) Season the tenderloin with salt and pepper and sear in a small amount of oil in a large rondeau. Remove from the pan and cool. Spread the surface of the tenderloin with the pt de foie gras. Sprinkle the truffles over the pt. Roll the puff pastry dough into a rectangle approximately 316 inch (5 millimeters) thick and large enough to wrap around the entire tenderloin. Turn the tenderloin over and place it lengthwise, pt side down, in the center of the pastry. Fold the ends over and wrap the pastry around the tenderloin, sealing it with egg wash and trimming off any excess. Transfer the Wellington to a baking sheet, placing the seam side down. Brush the surface with egg wash. Bake the Wellington in a 350F (180C) oven until the center reaches 125F130F (52C54C), approximately 40 minutes. Do not overcook; the crust holds in steam and heat, thus enhancing the effects of carryover cooking. Allow the meat to rest 5 minutes after baking. Carve the Wellington tableside or on a buffet with Madeira sauce served on the side. VARIATION: Individual Wellingtons can be made by cutting the tenderloin into 4- to 5-ounce (120- to 150-gram) filet mignons, using smaller pieces of puff pastry and reducing the cooking time to approx-imately 20 minutes.

fields.name: Mirepoix
fields.ingredient_amount: {'celery': ['celery', '1 lb', 'celery'], 'onion': ['onion', '2 lb', 'onion'], 'carrot': ['carrot', '1 lb', 'carrot']}
fields.directions: A mirepoix is a mixture of onions, carrots and celery added to a stock to enhance its flavor and aroma. Although chefs differ on the ratio of vegetables, generally a mixture of 50 percent onions, 25 percent carrots and 25 percent celery, by weight, is used. (Unless otherwise noted, any reference to mirepoix in this book refers to this ratio.) For a brown stock, onion skins may be used to add color. It is not necessary to peel the carrots or celery because flavor, not aesthetics, is important. The size into which the mirepoix is chopped is determined by the stocks cooking time: The shorter the cooking time, the smaller the vegetables must be chopped to ensure that all possible flavor is extracted. For white or brown stocks made from beef or veal bones, the vegetables should be coarsely chopped into large, 1- to 2-inch (2.5- to 5-centimeter) pieces. For chicken and fish stocks, the vegetables should be more finely chopped into 12-inch (1.2-centimeter) pieces.

fields.name: Chopped Fresh Herbs

fields.name: Demi-Glace

fields.name: Savory Fruit Compote
fields.ingredient_amount: {'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'onion': ['onion', '6 oz', 'onion'], 'apricots': ['apricots', '3 ea', 'apricots'], 'paprika': ['paprika to taste', '', 'paprika'], 'butter': ['butter', '1 oz', 'butter'], 'apple-granny-smith': ['granny smith apple', '3 ea', 'apple-granny-smith'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '4 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Sweat the onions in the butter or bacon fat without browning. Slice the apples or peaches and apricots into thin, even pieces. Add the apples to the onions and saut for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the apricots. Sprinkle the sugar over the fruits and cook, uncovered, over medium heat until tender. Season with paprika, salt and white pepper.

fields.name: Powdered Sugar Glaze
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '2 tsp', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'water': ['water', '2 tbl', 'water'], 'sugar-confectioners': ['confectioners sugar', '1 lb', 'sugar-confectioners'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '2 tsp', 'vanilla-extract']}

fields.directions: Sweat mirepoix and mushroom trimmings in butter until tender for 1 to 2 minutes. Combine all ingredients except the sachet in a stockpot. Bring to a simmer and skim impurities as necessary. Add the sachet and simmer uncovered for 30 to 45 minutes. Strain, cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: Orange Juice (fresh)

fields.name: Spinach Pasta Dough
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '2, 8 lb', 'flour-bread'], 'spinach-fresh': ['fresh spinach', '8 oz', 'spinach-fresh'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '1 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '15 ea', 'eggs']}
fields.directions: Place the eggs, oil and salt in a large mixer bowl. Use the paddle attachment to combine. Add one-third of the flour and stir until the mixture begins to form a soft dough. Remove the paddle attachment and attach the dough hook. Gradually add more flour until the dough is dry and cannot absorb any more flour. Remove the dough from the mixer, wrap it well with plastic wrap and set it aside at room temperature for 20 to 30 minutes. After the dough has rested, roll it into flat sheets by hand or with a pasta machine. Work with only a small portion at a time, keeping the remainder well covered to prevent it from drying out. While the sheets of dough are pliable, cut them into the desired width with a chefs knife or pasta machine. Sheets can also be used for making ravioli, as illustrated next. *Semolina flour can be substituted for all or part of the bread flour in this recipe, although it makes a stronger dough that is more difficult to work with by hand.                      Note: Spinach weight is 8 oz after cooking and draining
