fields.name: Boneless Strip Steaks (8 oz)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'beef-strip-loin': ['beef strip loin', '1 ea', 'beef-strip-loin']}
fields.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim meat of all excess fat and sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut strip loin into 8 oz steaks. Place in hotel pans or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.

fields.name: White Chocolate Buttercream
fields.ingredient_amount: {'water': ['water', '8 fl oz', 'water'], 'cra-me-de-cacao-white': ['white crÃ¨me de cacao', '3 fl oz', 'cra-me-de-cacao-white'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '2, 6 lb', 'butter-unsalted'], 'chocolate-white': ['white chocolate', '8 oz', 'chocolate-white'], 'egg-whites': ['egg whites', '9 ea', 'egg-whites'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1, 14 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: 1 Cook the sugar and water to 242F (117C), then pour into a measuring container with a handle for easier pouring. 2 Start whipping the egg whites when the sugar reaches 235F (113C). 3 When the whites are whipped to firm peaks, add the hot sugar syrup slowly while continuing to whip at low speed. Whip until completely cool. 4 Add the butter and whip until smooth. 5 Add the crme de cacao to the white chocolate. Whip until smooth, and then add the chocolate to the buttercream.

fields.name: Pineapple Papaya Salsa
fields.ingredient_amount: {'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '3 ea', 'tomatoes-fresh'], 'onion-green': ['green onion', '5 ea', 'onion-green'], 'pineapple': ['pineapple', '2 lb', 'pineapple'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tsp', 'garlic'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '3 tbl', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'papaya-fresh': ['fresh papaya', '1 lb', 'papaya-fresh'], 'salt': ['salt', '2 tsp', 'salt'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '1 bunch', 'cilantro-fresh'], 'pepper-jalapeno-chile': ['jalapeno chile pepper', '2 ea', 'pepper-jalapeno-chile']}
fields.directions: Core and dice the tomatoes. Peel and dice the pineapple. Peel, seed and dice the papaya. Combine all the ingredients and chill well.

fields.name: Decorative Cookie Icing
fields.ingredient_amount: {'food-coloring-red': ['red food coloringas needed', '', 'food-coloring-red'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '4 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'corn-syrup-light': ['light corn syrup', '2 fl oz', 'corn-syrup-light'], 'sugar-confectioners': ['confectioners sugar', '1 lb', 'sugar-confectioners'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 tsp', 'vanilla-extract']}
fields.directions: Combine the powdered sugar, lemon juice, corn syrup and vanilla in the bowl of a mixer fit-ted with the paddle attachment. Blend on low speed until the sugar dissolves and the mixture is smooth. Adjust the consistency of the icing by adding more water if necessary. Color as needed. Apply the icing to cookies and let them air dry until the icing hardens. Cover leftover icing and store it in the refrigerator, where it will keep about 3 weeks.

fields.name: Soft Yeast Dinner Rolls
fields.ingredient_amount: {'egg-wash': ['Egg Washas needed', '', 'egg-wash'], 'yeast-dry-active': ['dry active yeast', '2 oz', 'yeast-dry-active'], 'milk-nonfat-dry': ['nonfat dry milk', '2 oz', 'milk-nonfat-dry'], 'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '2, 12 lb', 'flour-bread'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '3.2 oz', 'eggs'], 'water': ['water', '1, 8 lb', 'water'], 'shortening-vegetable': ['vegetable shortening', '2 oz', 'shortening-vegetable'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '2 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 oz', 'salt'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '4 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: MISE EN PLACE  Adjust water temperature.  Soften butter.  Prepare the egg wash.  Line sheet pans with parchment while the dough ferments.  Dissolve the yeast in the water in a bowl. Combine the flour, salt, sugar, milk powder, shortening, butter and eggs in the bowl of a mixer fitted with a dough hook.  Add the water-and-yeast mixture to the mixer bowl; stir to combine.  Knead on medium speed 10 minutes or until the dough reaches 77F (25C).  Transfer the dough to a lightly greased bowl, cover and place in a warm spot. Ferment until doubled, approximately 1 hour.  Punch down the dough. Let it rest a few minutes to allow the gluten to relax.  Divide the dough into 1 1/4-ounce (38-gram) portions and round. Shape as desired and arrange on paper-lined sheet pans. Proof until doubled in size.  Carefully brush the proofed rolls with egg wash. Bake at 400F (200C) until medium brown, approximately 12 to 15 minutes.

fields.name: Fish Velout
fields.ingredient_amount: {'butter': ['butter', '8 fl oz', 'butter'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '8 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'fish-stock': ['Fish Stock', '5 qt', 'fish-stock'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Heat the butter in a heavy saucepan. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Gradually add the stock to the roux, stirring constantly with a whisk to prevent lumps. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. (Seasonings are optional; their use depends on the season-ings in the stock and the sauces intended use.) Simmer and reduce to 1 gallon (3.8 liters), approximately 30 minutes. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth. Melted butter may be carefully ladled over the surface of the sauce to prevent a skin from forming. Hold for service or cool in a water bath.

fields.name: Chilled Beet and Buttermilk Soup
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vinegar-red-wine': ['red wine vinegar', '1 fl oz', 'vinegar-red-wine'], 'onion-red': ['red onion', '1 ea', 'onion-red'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'chives-fresh': ['fresh chives', '2 tbl', 'chives-fresh'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1 oz', 'sugar-granulated'], 'buttermilk': ['buttermilk', '1 pt', 'buttermilk'], 'beets-red': ['red beets', '4 ea', 'beets-red'], 'cream-sour': ['sour cream', '1 fl oz', 'cream-sour'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: In a medium saucepan, combine the beets, onion, vinegar and sugar with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until tender, about 30 minutes. Strain, reserv-ing the liquid for later use. Pure the beets using a blender or food processor, adding enough of the reserved liquid to facilitate a smooth pure. When cooled to room temperature, stir in the buttermilk and season  to taste with salt and pepper. If the soup is too thick, dilute it with some of the reserved cooking liquid. Chill thor-oughly. Garnish with chopped chives and a quenelle of sour cream or crme frache.

fields.name: Tomato Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pork-bones': ['pork bones', '2 lb', 'pork-bones'], 'tomato-pura-e': ['tomato purÃ©e', '2 qt', 'tomato-pura-e'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 1/2 oz', 'salt'], 'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '1, 8 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '3 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'white-stock': ['White Stock', '3 qt', 'white-stock'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '10 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'salt-pork': ['salt pork', '4 oz', 'salt-pork'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '3 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '3 qt', 'tomatoes-fresh'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '3/4 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Render the salt pork over medium heat. Add the mirepoix and saut, but do not brown. Add the tomatoes, tomato pure, sachet, salt and sugar. Add the stock and bones. Simmer slowly for 1 to 2 hours or until the desired consistency has been reached. Remove the bones and sachet and pass the sauce through a food mill. Cool in a water bath and refrigerate.

fields.name: Pesce's Salsa Verde
fields.ingredient_amount: {'shallot': ['shallot', '2 oz', 'shallot'], 'lime-juice-fresh': ['Lime Juice (fresh)', '2 fl oz', 'lime-juice-fresh'], 'fish-sauce': ['fish sauce', '2 fl oz', 'fish-sauce'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '5 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'pepper-serrano-chile': ['serrano chile pepper', '1 tbl', 'pepper-serrano-chile'], 'pepper-flakes-red': ['red pepper flakes', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-flakes-red'], 'oil-extra-virgin-olive': ['extra virgin olive oil', '1 pt', 'oil-extra-virgin-olive'], 'parsley-fresh-italian': ['fresh Italian parsley', '2 oz', 'parsley-fresh-italian'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '3 tbl', 'garlic'], 'mint-fresh': ['fresh mint', '1/2 oz', 'mint-fresh'], 'basil-fresh': ['fresh basil', '1/2 oz', 'basil-fresh'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '4 oz', 'cilantro-fresh']}
fields.directions: 1 Place the herbs, shallots, garlic, serrano and chile flakes in a food processor and process to a paste. 2 With the machine running, add the lemon and lime juices. Add the fish sauce and slowly add the oil. Refrigerate.

fields.name: Candied Citrus Rind
fields.ingredient_amount: {'grapefruit-ruby-red': ['ruby red grapefruit', '2 ea', 'grapefruit-ruby-red'], 'lemon': ['lemon', '2 ea', 'lemon'], 'water': ['water', '1 qt', 'water'], 'corn-syrup-light': ['light corn syrup', '7 oz', 'corn-syrup-light'], 'oranges': ['oranges', '2 ea', 'oranges'], 'salt': ['salt', '1/2 tsp', 'salt'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugaras needed', '', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Wash the fruits. With a sharp knife, cut large, thin pieces of the peel from the citrus fruits. Remove as much of the white pith as possible. Cut the peel into long, thin strips, about 14 inch (6 millimeters) wide. Bring 1 pint (480 milliliters) water and the salt to boil in a saucepan large enough to hold the citrus rind. Add the rind and simmer for 2 minutes. Drain. Bring the remaining water, sugar and corn syrup to a boil. Add the blanched citrus rind and reduce the heat to a low simmer. Cook the rinds for about 15 to 20 minutes until they are translucent and tender. Store the rind in the syrup in the refrigerator. Or drain the rind on a screen until cool. Sprinkle the drained rind with granulated sugar and store in an airtight con-tainer.

fields.name: Lamb Noisettes
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lamb-loin-boneless': ['boneless lamb loin', '1 ea', 'lamb-loin-boneless']}
fields.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim lamb of all excess fat and sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut ribeye into noisettes. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.

fields.name: Bread Pudding with Bourbon Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '2 qt', 'cream-heavy'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 fl oz', 'vanilla-extract'], 'bread-white': ['white bread', '24 oz', 'bread-white'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '6 ea', 'eggs'], 'brandy': ['brandy', '4 fl oz', 'brandy'], 'raisins-golden': ['golden raisins', '8 oz', 'raisins-golden'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '2 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'bourbon-sauce': ['Bourbon Sauceas needed', '', 'bourbon-sauce'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1, 10 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Combine the raisins and brandy in a small saucepan. Heat just to a simmer, cover and set aside. Use a portion of the butter to thoroughly coat a 2-inch- (5-centimeter-) deep hotel pan. Re-serve the remaining butter. Tear the bread into chunks and place in a large bowl. Pour the cream over the bread and set aside until soft. Beat the eggs and sugar until smooth and thick. Add the vanilla, the remaining melted butter and the raisins and brandy. Toss the egg mixture with the bread gently to blend. Pour into the hotel pan and bake at 350F (180C) until browned and almost set, approximately 45 minutes. Serve warm with 11 1/2 fluid ounces (3045 milliliters) Bourbon Sauce. VARIATION: Chocolate Bread PuddingOmit the brandy, raisins and butter. Melt 6 ounces (180 grams) unsalted butter and 12 ounces (360 grams) bittersweet chocolate together. Add the chocolate and butter to the egg mixture in Step 4. Serve with Vanilla Custard Sauce (page 1050).

fields.name: Ladyfingers
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '5 oz', 'flour-bread'], 'sugar-confectioners': ['confectioners sugaras needed', '', 'sugar-confectioners'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '7 oz', 'egg-yolks'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '7 1/2 oz', 'sugar-granulated'], 'cornstarch': ['cornstarch', '4 oz', 'cornstarch'], 'egg-whites': ['egg whites', '12 ea', 'egg-whites'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 tsp', 'vanilla-extract']}
fields.directions: Sift the flour and cornstarch together. Set aside. Whip the egg yolks and vanilla together in the bowl of a mixer fitted with the whip attach-ment until the mixture is thick and creamy. Simultaneously, in a second mixer fitted with the whip attachment, whip the egg whites and granulated sugar until the mixture holds stiff peaks. Using a balloon whisk, gently stir the egg whites to restore a smooth appearance. Add the whipped yolks all at once into the egg whites. Gently fold the two together using a rubber spatula or a balloon whisk until the mixture is streaked in appearance and is not completely combined. Gently fold in the flour, taking care not to deflate the batter. Place the batter into a pastry bag fitted with a medium plain tip. Pipe 4-inch- (10-centimeter-) long cookies onto paper-lined sheet pans. Sprinkle the surface of the piped batter with powdered sugar. Let it sit for a few minutes until the powdered sugar dissolves. Sprinkle a second time with more powdered sugar. Bake immediately at 400F (200C) until the cookies bounce back when lightly pressed, ap-proximately 9 to 11 minutes.

fields.name: Fresh Spinach Pasta Dough
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '2 1/2 lb', 'flour-bread'], 'spinach-fresh': ['fresh spinach', '8 oz', 'spinach-fresh'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '1 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '15 ea', 'eggs']}
fields.directions: Place the eggs, oil, salt, and spinach in a large mixer bowl. Use the paddle attachment to combine. Add one-third of the flour and stir until the mixture begins to form a soft dough. Remove the paddle attachment and attach the dough hook. Gradually add more flour until the dough is dry and cannot absorb any more flour. Spinach Pasta may require additional flour. Remove the dough from the mixer, wrap it well with plastic wrap and set it aside at room temperature for 20 to 30 minutes. After the dough has rested, roll it into flat sheets by hand or with a pasta machine. Work with only a small portion at a time, keeping the remainder well covered to prevent it from drying out. While the sheets of dough are pliable, cut them into the desired width with a chefs knife or pasta machine. Sheets can also be used for making ravioli, as illustrated next. *Semolina flour can be substituted for all or part of the bread flour in this recipe, although it makes a stronger dough that is more difficult to work with by hand.

fields.name: Clarified Butter
fields.ingredient_amount: {'butter': ['butter', '1 lb', 'butter']}
fields.directions: Slowly warm the butter in a saucepan over low heat without boiling or agitation. As the butter melts, the milk solids rise to the top as a foam and the water sinks to the bottom. When the butter is completely melted, skim the milk solids from the top. When all the milk solids have been removed, ladle the butterfat into a clean saucepan, being careful to leave the water in the bottom of the pan. The clarified butter is now ready to use. One pound (454 grams) of whole butter will yield approximately 12 ounces (340 grams) of clarified buttera yield of 75%. Clarified butter will keep for extended periods in either the freezer or refrigerator.

fields.name: Pico de Gallo (Tomato Salsa)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'onion-green': ['green onion', '1 bunch', 'onion-green'], 'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '5 ea', 'tomatoes-fresh'], 'cumin-ground': ['ground cumin', '1/2 tsp', 'cumin-ground'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '2 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '3 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '1/2 bunch', 'cilantro-fresh'], 'pepper-jalapeno-chile': ['jalapeno chile pepper', '3 ea', 'pepper-jalapeno-chile']}
fields.directions: Combine all ingredients and gently toss. Adjust seasonings and refrigerate.

fields.name: Veal Pojarski
fields.ingredient_amount: {'veal-lean': ['lean veal', '2 lb', 'veal-lean'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 pt', 'cream-heavy'], 'fresh-bread-crumbs': ['Fresh Bread Crumbs', '9 1/2 oz', 'fresh-bread-crumbs'], 'nutmeg-ground': ['ground nutmeg', '1/4 tsp', 'nutmeg-ground'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1/4 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butteras needed', '', 'clarified-butter'], 'salt': ['salt', '1/2 tsp', 'salt'], 'chasseur-hunter-s-sauce': ["Chasseur (Hunter's Sauce)as needed", '', 'chasseur-hunter-s-sauce']}
fields.directions: Remove any gristle or thick fat from the veal. Pass it through a grinder once with the large die, and then once with the fine die. Spread the veal on a half-sheet pan and chill thoroughly. When the veal is thoroughly chilled, transfer it to a well-chilled bowl. Add the nutmeg, salt, pepper and cream. Blend well. Then blend in 4 ounces (120 grams) bread crumbs. Working quickly, divide the mixture into six portions and shape them into patties approx-imately 1 inch (2.5 centimeters) thick. Roll the patties in the remaining bread crumbs; chill until ready to cook. Heat two large saut pans and add a thin film of clarified butter to each one. Place half of the patties into each pan and cook until they are golden brown, approximately 5 minutes. Turn them over carefully and continue cooking until done, approximately 5 more minutes. Serve with chasseur sauce and roasted tourn potatoes and broccoli or other garnishes.

fields.name: Caramelized Berry Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'raspberries': ['raspberries', '11 oz', 'raspberries'], 'strawberries': ['strawberries', '7 oz', 'strawberries'], 'water': ['water', '4 fl oz', 'water'], 'veal-stock': ['Veal Stock', '4 qt', 'veal-stock'], 'blackberries': ['blackberries', '14 oz', 'blackberries'], 'blueberries': ['blueberries', '7 oz', 'blueberries'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '6 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Combine the sugar and water in a large saucepot. Bring to a boil and cook to a rich, golden brown. Add all the berries to the caramelized sugar. Cook for 1 minute. Add the veal stock and bring to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer and reduce by half. Strain the sauce through a fine chinois and keep warm for service.

fields.name: Classic Chocolate Mousse
fields.ingredient_amount: {'egg-whites-pasteurized': ['pasteurized egg whites', '11 ea', 'egg-whites-pasteurized'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '8 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'chocolate-bittersweet': ['bittersweet chocolate', '15 oz', 'chocolate-bittersweet'], 'egg-yolks-pasteurized': ['pasteurized egg yolks', '7 ea', 'egg-yolks-pasteurized'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '9 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '2 1/2 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Melt the chocolate and butter in a double boiler over low heat. Stir until no lumps remain. Allow the mixture to cool slightly, then whisk in the egg yolks one at a time. Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Slowly beat in the sugar and continue beating until stiff peaks form. Whisk one-fourth of the whipped egg whites into the chocolate mixture to lighten, then fold in the remaining whites. Whip the cream to soft peaks. Allow the mousse to cool to 90F95F (32C35C), then fold in the whipped cream. Make sure no streaks of egg white or cream remain. Spoon the mousse into serving bowls and garnish with whipped cream, fresh berries, shaved chocolate or mint. Or chill the mousse completely, then pipe it into bowls or baked tartlet shells. The mousse may also be used as a cake or pastry filling.

fields.name: Figs with Berries and Honey Mousse
fields.ingredient_amount: {'figs-black-mission': ['black mission figs', '1 pt', 'figs-black-mission'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 pt', 'cream-heavy'], 'raspberries': ['raspberries', '1 pt', 'raspberries'], 'egg-yolks-pasteurized': ['pasteurized egg yolks', '4 ea', 'egg-yolks-pasteurized'], 'honey': ['honey', '6 oz', 'honey'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Pick through the berries, rinse them and drain them in a colander. Rinse the figs and cut them in half, leaving the stem attached. To make the mousse, whisk the honey, yolks and salt together in a bowl over a pan of barely simmering water. Whisk the mixture continuously for 8 minutes. After 5 minutes, the mousse will begin to thicken and the texture will become creamy. Whisk vigorously until the mousse leaves thick ribbons on its surface when poured over itself. Set aside to cool. The texture of the cooled mousse will be stiff and sticky. Whisk 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) cream into the mousse, working it until it loosens. Whip the remaining cream until it is firm, fold it into the mousse until it is just incorporated, then whisk the two together. The texture will be light and creamy. Loosely arrange the figs on a platter, sprinkle with the berries, garnish with mint and serve with the mousse.

fields.name: Lamb Stock
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '2 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'water': ['water', '3 gal', 'water'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'tomato-paste': ['tomato paste', '8 oz', 'tomato-paste'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '3 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '12 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'lamb-bones': ['lamb bones', '15 lb', 'lamb-bones']}
fields.directions: Place the bones in a roasting pan, one layer deep, and brown in a 375F (190C) oven. Turn the bones occasionally to brown them evenly. Remove the bones and place them in a stockpot. Pour off the fat from the roasting pan and reserve it. Deglaze the roasting pan with part of the cold water. Add the deglazing liquor and the rest of the cold water to the bones, covering them completely. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Add a portion of the reserved fat to the roasting pan and saut the mirepoix until evenly browned. Then add it to the simmering stock. Add the tomato paste and sachet to the stock and continue to simmer for 6 to 8 hours, skim-ming as necessary. Strain, cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: Pork Tenderloin Medallions (2 oz)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pork-tenderloin': ['pork tenderloin', '1 ea', 'pork-tenderloin']}
fields.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim pork tenderloin of any fat or silverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 2 oz medallions. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.

fields.name: Carrot Pure
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cumin-whole': ['whole cumin', '1 tsp', 'cumin-whole'], 'honey': ['honey', '1 fl oz', 'honey'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '3 oz', 'butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'carrot': ['carrot', '1 lb', 'carrot'], 'harissa': ['harissa', '1 tbl', 'harissa']}
fields.directions: 1 Boil the carrots in salted water until very tender. Drain well and pure in a food processor with the remaining ingredients. Hold warm for service.

fields.name: Turkey Breast Scallops (3 oz)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'turkey-breast-4-7-lb-bone-in': ['bone in turkey breast 4-7 lb', '1 ea', 'turkey-breast-4-7-lb-bone-in']}
fields.directions: Working on a poultry-designated cutting board - take turkey off the breast bone. Remove skin from breast. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 3 oz scallops. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.

fields.name: Breaded Veal Cutlets
fields.ingredient_amount: {'veal-cutlets-4-oz': ['Veal Cutlets (4 oz)', '10 ea', 'veal-cutlets-4-oz'], 'lemon': ['lemon', '20 wedge', 'lemon'], 'bread-crumbs-dried': ['dried bread crumbsas needed', '', 'bread-crumbs-dried'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter': ['butter', '6 oz', 'butter'], 'eggs': ['eggsas needed', '', 'eggs'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flouras needed', '', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'milk': ['milkas needed', '', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oilas needed', '', 'oil-vegetable']}
fields.directions: Using a mallet, pound the cutlets to an even thickness, approximately 14 inch (6 millimeters). Season the cutlets with salt and pepper. Bread the cutlets using the standard breading procedure described in Chapter 8, Mise en Place. Heat a heavy pan to moderate heat; add approximately 18 inch (3 millimeters) oil. Add the cutlets in a single layer. Do not crowd the pan. Brown on one side, then the other. Total cooking time should be approximately 4 minutes. Remove the cutlets and drain on absorbent paper. Melt the butter in a small pan until it foams. Place one cutlet on each plate and pour approximately 12 fluid ounce (15 milliliters) butter over each portion. Garnish with lemon wedges.

fields.name: Grimrod Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'hollandaise': ['Hollandaise', '1 qt', 'hollandaise'], 'saffron': ['saffron', '1/8 tsp', 'saffron']}
fields.directions: Infuse a hollandaise sauce with saffron.

fields.name: Fresh Bread Crumbs
fields.ingredient_amount: {'bread-white': ['white bread', '1 1/2 loaf', 'bread-white']}
fields.directions: Directions:

fields.name: Thyme-Scented Celery Essence
fields.ingredient_amount: {'tomato-juice': ['tomato juice', '1 pt', 'tomato-juice'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1/2 oz', 'thyme-fresh'], 'butter': ['butter', '6 oz', 'butter'], 'celery-juice': ['Celery Juice', '1 qt', 'celery-juice'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'tabasco-sauce': ['tabasco sauce to taste', '', 'tabasco-sauce']}
fields.directions: Combine the celery juice, tomato juice and thyme. Bring to a simmer and reduce to 24 fluid ounces (720 milliliters). Whisk in the butter and adjust the seasonings with salt and Tabasco sauce. Strain through a chinois.

fields.name: Basic Pasta Dough
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '2, 8 lb', 'flour-bread'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '1 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '15 ea', 'eggs']}
fields.directions: Place the eggs, oil and salt in a large mixer bowl. Use the paddle attachment to combine. Add one-third of the flour and stir until the mixture begins to form a soft dough. Remove the paddle attachment and attach the dough hook. Gradually add more flour until the dough is dry and cannot absorb any more flour. Remove the dough from the mixer, wrap it well with plastic wrap and set it aside at room temperature for 20 to 30 minutes. After the dough has rested, roll it into flat sheets by hand or with a pasta machine. Work with only a small portion at a time, keeping the remainder well covered to prevent it from drying out. While the sheets of dough are pliable, cut them into the desired width with a chefs knife or pasta machine. Sheets can also be used for making ravioli, as illustrated next. *Semolina flour can be substituted for all or part of the bread flour in this recipe, although it makes a stronger dough that is more difficult to work with by hand. VARIATIONS: Garlic-HerbRoast one head of garlic. Peel and pure the cloves and add to the eggs. Add up to 2 ounces (60 grams) finely chopped assorted fresh herbs just before mixing is complete. SpinachAdd 8 ounces (240 grams) cooked, pured and well-drained spinach to the eggs. In-crease the amount of flour slightly if necessary. TomatoAdd 4 ounces (120 grams) tomato paste to the eggs; omit the salt. Increase the amount of flour slightly if necessary.

fields.name: Sweet Dough
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '3, 8 lb', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '1 lb', 'egg-yolks'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '2 ea', 'eggs'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1, 8 lb', 'butter-unsalted'], 'sugar-confectioners': ['confectioners sugar', '1, 5 lb', 'sugar-confectioners']}
fields.directions: Cream the butter and powdered sugar in the large bowl of a mixer fitted with the paddle at-tachment. Combine the egg yolks and whole eggs. Slowly add the eggs to the creamed butter. Mix until smooth and free of lumps, scraping down the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, slowly add the flour to the butter-and-egg mixture. Mix only until incorporated; do not overmix. The dough should be firm, smooth and not sticky. Dust a half-sheet pan with flour. Pack the dough into the pan evenly. Wrap well in plastic wrap and chill until firm. Work with a small portion of the chilled dough when shaping tart shells or other products.

fields.name: Shrimp Bisque
fields.ingredient_amount: {'wine-dry-sherry': ['dry sherry wine', '4 fl oz', 'wine-dry-sherry'], 'wine-dry-white': ['dry white wine', '12 fl oz', 'wine-dry-white'], 'brandy': ['brandy', '4 fl oz', 'brandy'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '2 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'shrimp-16-20-ct': ['16-20 ct shrimp', '1 lb', 'shrimp-16-20-ct'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'fish-velouta': ['Fish VeloutÃ©', '4 qt', 'fish-velouta'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '1 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 pt', 'cream-heavy'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'tomato-paste': ['tomato paste', '2 oz', 'tomato-paste'], 'shrimp-shells': ['shrimp shells', '2 lb', 'shrimp-shells'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '8 ea', 'parsley-fresh'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'basil-fresh': ['fresh basilas needed', '', 'basil-fresh'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '3 fl oz', 'clarified-butter'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'pepper-cayenne': ['cayenne pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-cayenne']}
fields.directions: Caramelize the mirepoix and shrimp shells in the butter. Add the garlic and tomato paste and saut lightly. Add the brandy and flamb. Add the wine. Deglaze and reduce the liquid by half. Add the velout and sachet and simmer for approximately 1 hour, skimming occasionally. Strain, discarding the sachet and reserving the liquid and solids. Pure the solids and return them to the liquid. Return to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Strain the bisque through a fine chinois or china cap lined with cheesecloth. Return the bisque to a simmer and add the cream. Season  to taste with salt, white pepper and cayenne pepper. Add sherry, if using. 10. Cook the shrimp and slice or dice them as desired. Garnish each portion of soup with cooked shrimp and the basil chiffonade.

fields.name: Lemon-Dill Beurre Blanc
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '2 tbl', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'beurre-blanc': ['Beurre Blanc', '1 qt', 'beurre-blanc'], 'dill-fresh': ['fresh dill', '4 tbl', 'dill-fresh']}
fields.directions: Heat 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) lemon juice and whisk it into the beurre blanc. Stir in 4 tablespoons (60 milliliters) chopped fresh dill.

fields.name: New England-Style Clam Chowder
fields.ingredient_amount: {'potato-white': ['white potato', '1, 4 lb', 'potato-white'], 'celery': ['celery', '8 oz', 'celery'], 'salt-pork': ['salt pork', '8 oz', 'salt-pork'], 'water': ['water', '1 1/2 qt', 'water'], 'milk': ['milk', '1 qt', 'milk'], 'tabasco-sauce': ['tabasco sauce to taste', '', 'tabasco-sauce'], 'carrot': ['carrotas needed', '', 'carrot'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '8 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'onion': ['onion', '1 lb', 'onion'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme to taste', '', 'thyme-fresh'], 'butter': ['butter', '2 oz', 'butter'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsleyas needed', '', 'parsley-fresh'], 'worcestershire-sauce': ['worcestershire sauce to taste', '', 'worcestershire-sauce'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '4 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'clams-canned': ['canned clams', '2 qt', 'clams-canned']}
fields.directions: Drain the clams, reserving both the clams and their liquid. Add enough water or stock so that the total liquid equals 2 quarts (1.9 liters). Simmer the potatoes in the clam liquid until nearly cooked through. Strain and reserve the potatoes and the liquid. Render the salt pork with the butter. Add the onions and celery to the rendered fat and sweat until tender but not brown. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Add the clam liquid to the roux, whisking away any lumps. Simmer for 30 minutes, skimming as necessary. Bring the milk and cream to a boil and add to the soup. Add the clams and potatoes, and season  to taste with salt, pepper, Tabasco sauce, Worcester-shire sauce and thyme. Garnish each serving with fresh parsley and julienned carrot as desired. Note: If using fresh clams for the chowder, wash and steam approximately 12 bushel (15 liters) chowder clams in a small amount of water to yield 114 quarts (1.4 liters) clam meat. Chop the clams. Strain the liquid through several layers of cheesecloth to remove any sand that may be present. Add enough water or stock so that the total liquid is 2 quarts (1.9 liters). Continue with the recipe, starting at step 2.

fields.name: Veal Cordon Bleu
fields.ingredient_amount: {'egg-wash': ['Egg Washas needed', '', 'egg-wash'], 'ham': ['ham', '4 oz', 'ham'], 'cheese-swiss': ['Swiss cheese', '4 oz', 'cheese-swiss'], 'lemon': ['lemonas needed', '', 'lemon'], 'bread-crumbs-dried': ['dried bread crumbsas needed', '', 'bread-crumbs-dried'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '4 tsp', 'parsley-fresh'], 'veal-cutlets-4-oz': ['Veal Cutlets (4 oz)', '4 ea', 'veal-cutlets-4-oz'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flouras needed', '', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Place the veal cutlets on a film-covered cutting board and cover them with a layer of film wrap. Using a meat mallet, gently pound the cutlets to an even thickness of approximately 14 inch (6 millimeters). Remove the film wrap. Season the cutlets with salt and white pepper and sprinkle them with the parsley. Place one slice of ham and one slice of cheese on each cutlet. If the slices are larger than the cutlet, cut the slices in half and layer them on the cutlet. Begin rolling the veal cutlet. Fold the ends toward the center to close the ends of the roll and finish rolling. Refrigerate the veal rolls for 15 minutes. Bread the veal rolls using the standard breading procedure described in Chapter 8, Mise en Place, and refrigerate for an additional 15 minutes. Using the basket method, deep-fry the rolls at 325F (160C) until fully cooked, approx-imately 8 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges. Flavored hollandaise or barnaise sauce may also be served with this dish. VARIATION: Turkey Cordon BleuSubstitute 4-ounce (120-gram) turkey breast cutlets for the veal.

fields.name: Mornay Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy creamas needed', '', 'cream-heavy'], 'butter': ['butter', '2 oz', 'butter'], 'ba-chamel': ['BÃ©chamel', '1 qt', 'ba-chamel'], 'cheese-parmesan': ['parmesan cheese', '1 oz', 'cheese-parmesan'], 'cheese-gruyere': ['gruyere cheese', '4 oz', 'cheese-gruyere'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Add to bchamel 4 ounces (120 grams) grated Gruyre and 1 ounce (30 grams) grated Parmesan. Thin as desired with scalded cream. Remove the sauce from the heat and swirl in 2 ounces (60 grams) whole butter.

fields.name: Chicken Velout
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '8 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '5 qt', 'chicken-stock'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '8 fl oz', 'clarified-butter']}
fields.directions: Heat the butter in a heavy saucepan. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Gradually add the stock to the roux, stirring constantly with a whisk to prevent lumps. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. (Seasonings are optional; their use depends on the season-ings in the stock and the sauces intended use.) Simmer and reduce to 1 gallon (3.8 liters), approximately 30 minutes. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth. Melted butter may be carefully ladled over the surface of the sauce to prevent a skin from forming. Hold for service or cool in a water bath.

fields.name: Sugar Syrup (medium)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'water': ['water', '24 fl oz', 'water'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '16 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Combine ingredients in heavy-bottomed stainless saucepan. Boil for 1 minute. This concentration would measure 2124 on the Baum scale. Store in clean container in refrigerator.

fields.name: Beef Fajitas
fields.ingredient_amount: {'beef-skirt-steak': ['beef skirt steak', '2 lb', 'beef-skirt-steak'], 'onion-powder': ['onion powder', '1 1/2 tsp', 'onion-powder'], 'chili-powder': ['chili powder', '1 1/2 tsp', 'chili-powder'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '2 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'cumin-ground': ['ground cumin', '1 1/2 tsp', 'cumin-ground'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 1/2 tsp', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '2 tbl', 'oil-vegetable'], 'onion': ['onion', '1 ea', 'onion'], 'pepper-green-bell': ['green bell pepper', '1 ea', 'pepper-green-bell'], 'pepper-yellow-bell': ['yellow bell pepper', '1 ea', 'pepper-yellow-bell'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1 1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'pepper-red-bell': ['red bell pepper', '1 ea', 'pepper-red-bell'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '6 sprig', 'cilantro-fresh']}
fields.directions: Make the marinade by chopping and mashing the garlic into a paste. In a bowl, combine the garlic paste with the remaining marinade ingredients. Trim the fat from the skirt steak. Cut the steak into two or three pieces if necessary. Add the steaks to the marinade, turning them several times to coat all sides. Cover the steak and mari-nate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or overnight. Grill the steak on a hot grill to the desired doneness. Remove the steak and allow it to rest for 10 minutes. Add the oil to a heavy saut pan, heat the pan until very hot and saut the bell peppers, onion and garlic just until they begin to soften. Slice the steak against the grain into thin slices. Arrange the steak and the pepper mixture on very hot cast-iron platters and garnish with the cilantro. The platters should be sizzling as they are presented to the table. Serve the fajitas accompanied by warm flour or corn tortillas, fresh salsa, sour cream, and guacamole.

fields.name: Shellfish Stock

fields.directions: D:

fields.name: Normandy Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy creamas needed', '', 'cream-heavy'], 'fish-stock': ['Fish Stock', '4 fl oz', 'fish-stock'], 'mushrooms-medium': ['medium mushrooms', '4 oz', 'mushrooms-medium'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '1 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'fish-velouta': ['Fish VeloutÃ©', '1 qt', 'fish-velouta'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Add 4 ounces (120 grams) mushroom trimmings and 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) fish stock to 1 quart (960 milliliters) fish velout. Reduce by one-third and finish with an egg yolk and cream liaison. Strain through a fine chinois. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Zucchini Bread
fields.ingredient_amount: {'oil-corn': ['corn oil', '8 fl oz', 'oil-corn'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '1 tsp', 'vanilla-extract'], 'baking-powder': ['baking powder', '1/2 tsp', 'baking-powder'], 'cinnamon-ground': ['ground cinnamon', '2 tsp', 'cinnamon-ground'], 'zucchini': ['zucchini', '11 oz', 'zucchini'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '3 ea', 'eggs'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '14 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'pecan-halves': ['pecan halves', '4 oz', 'pecan-halves'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tsp', 'salt'], 'baking-soda': ['baking soda', '1 tsp', 'baking-soda'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1, 2 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Combine all ingredients using the muffin method. Bake in two greased loaf pans at 350F (180C), approximately 1 hour.

fields.name: Classic Genoise
fields.ingredient_amount: {'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 1/2 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '10 ea', 'eggs'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '8 oz', 'sugar-granulated'], 'flour-cake': ['cake flour', '9 oz', 'flour-cake'], 'vanilla-extract': ['vanilla extract', '2 tsp', 'vanilla-extract']}
fields.directions: Whisk the eggs and sugar together in a large mixer bowl. Place the bowl over a bain marie and whisk the mixture continuously to warm the eggs to approximately 105F to 113F (40C to 45C). When the eggs are warm, remove the bowl from the bain marie and attach it to a mixer fitted with the whip attachment. Whip the egg-and-sugar mixture at medium speed until the mix-ture is cool and forms thick ribbons, approximately 12 to 15 minutes. If using the melted butter, remove approximately one-eighth of the batter. Place it in a small bowl and mix it with the melted butter. Set aside. Using a rubber spatula or balloon whisk, delicately fold the flour into the remaining genoise batter. Carefully fold in the reserved butter-genoise mixture. Spread the batter immediately onto a paper-lined sheet pan. Bake at 425F (220C) until light brown and springy to the touch, approximately 10 minutes. VARIATION: Chocolate GenoiseReduce the cake flour to 7 ounces (210 grams). Sift 2 ounces (60 grams) cocoa powder with the flour.

fields.name: Southeast Asian-Style Peanut Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vinegar-rice': ['rice vinegar', '4 fl oz', 'vinegar-rice'], 'lime-leaves': ['lime leaves', '4 ea', 'lime-leaves'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tsp', 'garlic'], 'curry-powder': ['curry powder', '2 tsp', 'curry-powder'], 'cinnamon-stick': ['cinnamon stick', '2 ea', 'cinnamon-stick'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '1 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'onion': ['onion', '6 oz', 'onion'], 'pepper-flakes-red': ['red pepper flakes', '1 tsp', 'pepper-flakes-red'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '4 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '10 fl oz', 'chicken-stock'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '1 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'lemongrass': ['lemongrass', '1 oz', 'lemongrass'], 'coconut-milk': ['coconut milk', '8 fl oz', 'coconut-milk'], 'peanut-butter': ['peanut butter', '10 oz', 'peanut-butter']}
fields.directions: Saut the garlic, onion, red pepper flakes, lime leaves, curry powder and lemongrass in the oil for 5 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir often, as the sauce can burn easily. Remove the cinnamon and bay leaves and serve warm. VARIATION: Vegetarian Peanut SauceSubstitute vegetable stock or water for the chicken stock.

fields.name: Soy Dipping Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vinegar-cider': ['cider vinegar', '3 tbl', 'vinegar-cider'], 'water': ['water', '2 fl oz', 'water'], 'onion-green': ['green onion', '2 oz', 'onion-green'], 'soy-sauce': ['soy sauce', '2 fl oz', 'soy-sauce'], 'oil-hot-chile': ['hot chile oil to taste', '', 'oil-hot-chile']}
fields.directions: Combine all ingredients.

fields.name: Guacamole
fields.ingredient_amount: {'avocado': ['avocado', '6 ea', 'avocado'], 'onion-green': ['green onion', '4 tbl', 'onion-green'], 'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '3 tbl', 'tomatoes-fresh'], 'tomato-concassa': ['Tomato ConcassÃ©as needed', '', 'tomato-concassa'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '2 1/2 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tsp', 'garlic'], 'oregano-dried-whole': ['dried whole oregano', '1/2 tsp', 'oregano-dried-whole'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '3 tbl', 'cilantro-fresh'], 'pepper-jalapeno-chile': ['jalapeno chile pepper', '1 ea', 'pepper-jalapeno-chile']}
fields.directions: Cut each avocado in half. Remove the seed and scoop out the pulp. Add the lemon juice to the avocado pulp and mix well, mashing the avocado pulp. Add the remaining ingredients except the tomato concass. Season with salt and mix well. Garnish with tomato concass and served with assorted corn chips.

fields.name: San Francisco Sourdough Bread
fields.ingredient_amount: {'yeast-dry-active': ['dry active yeast', '1/2 oz', 'yeast-dry-active'], 'flour-bread': ['bread flour', '1 lb', 'flour-bread'], 'cornmeal-yellow': ['yellow cornmealas needed', '', 'cornmeal-yellow'], 'water': ['water', '8 fl oz', 'water'], 'egg-whites': ['egg whites', '1 ea', 'egg-whites'], 'simple-sourdough-starter': ['Simple Sourdough Starter', '6 oz', 'simple-sourdough-starter'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt', '1 tbl', 'salt-kosher']}
fields.directions: Sprinkle the dry yeast over 2 fluid ounces (60 milliliters) warm water and set aside until dis-solved and foamy. In the bowl of a mixer fitted with a dough hook, combine the starter and the remaining warm water. Add 6 ounces (180 grams) bread flour. Stir until a dough forms, then add the yeast mixture. Knead 5 minutes on medium speed. Add the remaining flour and the salt. Knead until the dough is smooth and elastic, approximately 10 minutes. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl and cover with a damp cloth. Ferment the dough in a warm place, approximately 80F to 90F (27C to 32C), until doubled. Punch down the dough and shape it into a round loaf. Place the loaf on a greased and corn-meal-dusted sheet pan. Proof the dough in a warm place, covered with a damp cloth, until it has risen to 2 1/2 times its original size. Brush the risen loaf with the beaten egg white and score the top of the loaf with a sharp knife. Bake at 450F (230C), with a pan of boiling water underneath the oven rack, for 10 minutes. 10. Reduce the oven temperature to 375F (190C), remove the water and continue baking until the loaf is well browned, approximately 35 to 45 minutes.

fields.name: Pastry Cream (Crme Ptissire)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cornstarch': ['cornstarch', '2.5 oz', 'cornstarch'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '10 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '2 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'milk': ['milk', '1 qt', 'milk'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '7 1/2 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Boil the milk and 3 ounces (120 grams) sugar in a large nonreactive saucepan. Whisk the egg yolks in a mixing bowl and gradually add the remaining sugar. Whisk in the cornstarch to combine. Temper the egg yolk mixture with one-quarter of the boiling milk. Return the egg mixture to the pan and cook, whisking vigorously until the cream boils and is well thickened. Allow the pastry cream to boil approximately 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove the pastry cream from the heat and immediately pour it into a clean mixing bowl. Fold in the butter until melted. Do not overmix, as this will thin the custard. Cover by placing plastic wrap on the surface of the custard. Chill over an ice bath. Remove the vanilla bean just before using the pastry cream. VARIATIONS: Chocolate Pastry CreamStir 4 ounces (120 grams) finely chopped dark chocolate into the strained custard while it is still warm. The heat of the custard will melt the chocolate. Coffee Pastry CreamAdd 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) coffee extract or compound to the warm custard. Mousseline Pastry CreamWhip 12 fluid ounces (360 milliliters) heavy cream to stiff peaks. Fold into the chilled Pastry Cream Filling.

fields.name: Red-Wine Thyme Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'rosemary-fresh': ['fresh rosemary', '1 sprig', 'rosemary-fresh'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '2 oz', 'shallot'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1 sprig', 'thyme-fresh'], 'wine-red': ['red wine', '8 fl oz', 'wine-red'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tbl', 'garlic'], 'veal-stock': ['Veal Stock', '1 qt', 'veal-stock'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 oz', 'butter-unsalted']}
fields.directions: 1 Saut the shallot lightly in the clarified butter until slightly caramelized. 2 Add the wine, thyme and bay leaf and reduce by one-third. 3 Squeeze in the garlic, discarding the skins and root. 4 Add the demi-glace and reduce by one-third. 5 Thicken slightly with roux if desired, adjust the seasonings and force through a fine strainer.

fields.name: Wild Mushroom Ragot
fields.ingredient_amount: {'tomatoes-plum': ['plum tomatoes', '4 ea', 'tomatoes-plum'], 'wine-white': ['white wine', '1 pt', 'wine-white'], 'bacon': ['bacon', '3 oz', 'bacon'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tbl', 'garlic'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'mushrooms-porcini': ['porcini mushrooms', '4 oz', 'mushrooms-porcini'], 'veal-demi-glace': ['Veal Demi-Glace', '1 qt', 'veal-demi-glace'], 'mushrooms-chanterelle': ['chanterelle mushrooms', '4 oz', 'mushrooms-chanterelle'], 'mushrooms-shiitake': ['shiitake mushrooms', '4 oz', 'mushrooms-shiitake'], 'thyme-fresh': ['fresh thyme', '1 tbl', 'thyme-fresh'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'leeks': ['leeks', '4 oz', 'leeks'], 'onion-pearl': ['pearl onion', '10 oz', 'onion-pearl'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '1 tbl', 'shallot']}
fields.directions: Render the bacon in a saucepot. Add the garlic, shallot, leeks, onions and thyme and saut until tender. Add the mushrooms and saut for 5 minutes. Deglaze with the wine and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. Add the demi-glace and reduce to the desired consistency, approximately 15 minutes. Add the tomato concasse, adjust the seasonings and hold for service.

fields.name: Redfish Sopa Base
fields.ingredient_amount: {'oil-grapeseed': ['grapeseed oil', '1 fl oz', 'oil-grapeseed'], 'bouquet-garni': ['Bouquet Garni', '1 ea', 'bouquet-garni'], 'corn-fresh': ['fresh corn', '4 ea', 'corn-fresh'], 'celery': ['celery', '12 oz', 'celery'], 'cumin-ground': ['ground cumin', '1 tbl', 'cumin-ground'], 'chili-powder': ['chili powder', '2 tbl', 'chili-powder'], 'pepper-serrano-chile': ['serrano chile pepper', '3 ea', 'pepper-serrano-chile'], 'shellfish-stock': ['Shellfish Stock', '1 1/2 gal', 'shellfish-stock'], 'masa-harina': ['masa harina', '3 oz', 'masa-harina'], 'pepper-green-bell': ['green bell pepper', '5 oz', 'pepper-green-bell'], 'onion-yellow': ['yellow onion', '12 oz', 'onion-yellow'], 'pepper-poblano-chile': ['poblano chile pepper', '2 1/2 oz', 'pepper-poblano-chile'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 tbl', 'garlic'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '2 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'water': ['water', '4 fl oz', 'water'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt', '3 tbl', 'salt-kosher']}
fields.directions: 1 Cut the corn kernels from the cobs. Reserve the corn and the cobs. 2 Heat the oil in a small stockpot. Add the garlic, onions, bell peppers, poblanos and celery. Cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly caramelized, approximately 8 to 10 minutes. 3 Add the stock, corn cobs and bouquet garni. Bring to a boil and reduce by half. Remove and discard the corn cobs. 4 Make a slurry with the masa harina and water. Add to the stock while whisking to prevent lumps. Stir in the chilli powder and cumin. 5 Add the serrano chiles, corn kernels, salt and pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes, remove from the heat and pure the base in a blender. Chill and reserve.

fields.name: Basil Butter
fields.ingredient_amount: {'shallot': ['shallot', '2 oz', 'shallot'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '2 tsp', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 lb', 'butter-unsalted'], 'basil-fresh': ['fresh basil', '2 oz', 'basil-fresh'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Mince 2 ounces (60 grams) fresh basil and 2 ounces (60 grams) shallots; add to the butter with 2 teaspoons (10 milliliters) lemon juice.

fields.name: Crayfish Butter
fields.ingredient_amount: {'crawfish-tails': ['crawfish tails', '8 oz', 'crawfish-tails'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 lb', 'butter-unsalted'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'pepper-ground-white': ['ground white pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-white']}
fields.directions: Grind 8 ounces (240 grams) cooked crayfish meat, shells and/or coral with 1 pound (480 grams) butter. Place in a saucepan and clarify. Strain the butter through a fine chinois lined with cheesecloth. Refrigerate, then remove the butterfat when firm.

fields.name: Poultry Demi-Glace
fields.ingredient_amount: {'velouta': ['VeloutÃ©', '1 qt', 'velouta'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '1 qt', 'chicken-stock']}
fields.directions: Combine the stock and sauce in a saucepan over medium heat. Simmer until the mixture is reduced by half (a yield of 1 quart or 960 milliliters ). Strain and cool in a water bath.

fields.name: Grilled Fruit Kebabs
fields.ingredient_amount: {'melon-honeydew': ['honeydew melon', '1/4 ea', 'melon-honeydew'], 'melon-cantaloupe': ['cantaloupe melon', '1/2 ea', 'melon-cantaloupe'], 'strawberries': ['strawberries', '8 ea', 'strawberries'], 'lime-juice-fresh': ['Lime Juice (fresh)', '4 fl oz', 'lime-juice-fresh'], 'sugar-light-brown': ['light brown sugar', '2 oz', 'sugar-light-brown'], 'pineapple': ['pineapple', '1/2 ea', 'pineapple'], 'cinnamon-ground': ['ground cinnamon', '1/4 tsp', 'cinnamon-ground']}
fields.directions: Remove the rind and cut the melons and pineapple into 1-inch (2.5-centimeter) cubes. Hull the strawberries and leave whole. To make the sugar glaze, combine the sugar, lime juice and cinnamon, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Heat the grill and clean the grate thoroughly. Thread the fruits onto kebab skewers, alternating colors for an attractive appearance. Brush the fruits with the sugar glaze. Grill, rotating the skewers frequently to develop an evenly light brown surface. Serve immediately as an appetizer, a garnish for ice cream or an accompaniment to rich meats such as pork or lamb.

fields.name: Citrus Beurre Blanc
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lime-zest': ['Lime Zest', '1 tbl', 'lime-zest'], 'wine-white': ['white wine', '8 fl oz', 'wine-white'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '1 tbl', 'shallot'], 'lime-juice-fresh': ['Lime Juice (fresh)', '1 tbl', 'lime-juice-fresh'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '1 tbl', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'orange-juice-fresh': ['Orange Juice (fresh)', '8 fl oz', 'orange-juice-fresh'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 tbl', 'cream-heavy'], 'vinegar-white-wine': ['white wine vinegar', '8 fl oz', 'vinegar-white-wine'], 'orange-zest': ['Orange Zest', '1 tbl', 'orange-zest'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 lb', 'butter-unsalted'], 'lemon-zest': ['Lemon Zest', '1 tbl', 'lemon-zest']}
fields.directions: Combine the citrus juices, wine, vinegar and shallot and reduce au sec over moderate heat. Whisk in the cream, then whisk in the butter 2 ounces (60 grams) at a time. Strain the sauce, season with salt and pepper and stir in the citrus rinds. Keep hot for service.

fields.name: Crunchy Granola
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pecan-pieces': ['pecan pieces', '4 oz', 'pecan-pieces'], 'flour-whole-wheat': ['whole wheat flour', '2 oz', 'flour-whole-wheat'], 'oil-canola': ['canola oil', '6 fl oz', 'oil-canola'], 'water': ['water', '4 fl oz', 'water'], 'sugar-light-brown': ['light brown sugar', '8 oz', 'sugar-light-brown'], 'oats-old-fashioned': ['old-fashioned oats', '18 oz', 'oats-old-fashioned'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt'], 'cornmeal-yellow': ['yellow cornmeal', '2 oz', 'cornmeal-yellow'], 'flour-amaranth': ['amaranth flour', '2 oz', 'flour-amaranth'], 'coconut-shredded': ['shredded coconut', '2 1/2 oz', 'coconut-shredded'], 'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '2 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'wheat-germ': ['wheat germ', '4 oz', 'wheat-germ']}
fields.directions: Dissolve the brown sugar in the hot water. Add the oil. Combine the dry ingredients in a large bowl. Mix thoroughly by hand. Add the brown-sugar-and-oil mixture to the dry ingredients; toss to combine. Spread out the granola in a thin layer on a sheet pan. Bake at 200F (90C) until crisp, approximately 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Toss lightly with a metal spatula every 30 minutes. Cool completely at room temperature, then store in an airtight container. Chopped dried fruits, additional nuts or fresh fruits can be added at service time. Serve plain or as a topping on fresh berries and yogurt.

fields.name: Ganache
fields.ingredient_amount: {'chocolate-semisweet': ['semisweet chocolate', '4 oz', 'chocolate-semisweet'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '3 fl oz', 'cream-heavy']}
fields.directions: Chop the chocolate into small pieces and place in a bowl. Heat the cream just to boiling. Pour the cream over the chocolate and stir until the mixture is glossy and smooth. Allow to cool slightly before using.

fields.name: Italian Herb Blend
fields.ingredient_amount: {'sage-fresh': ['fresh sage', '1 bunch', 'sage-fresh'], 'oregano-fresh': ['fresh oregano', '1 bunch', 'oregano-fresh'], 'basil-fresh': ['fresh basil', '1 bunch', 'basil-fresh'], 'parsley-fresh-italian': ['fresh Italian parsley', '1 bunch', 'parsley-fresh-italian']}
fields.directions: Wash all herbs in salad spinner. Dry well. Using vegetable-designated cutting board, chop to desired consistency.

fields.name: Croutons
fields.ingredient_amount: {'bread-white': ['white bread', '4 slice', 'bread-white'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butter', '4 fl oz', 'clarified-butter'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Heat the butter in a small saut or sauce pan over medium heat to 325 (163C). Trim the crust from the white bread and cut into uniform cubes. Pan fry the croutons in small batches in the butter until golden brown and cooked through. Stir frequently for even browning. As each batch is done remove to absorbent paper towel and toss with salt while still warm. Remove to a clean bowl and continue until all the croutons are fried

fields.name: Citrus Vanilla Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vanilla-bean': ['vanilla bean', '1 ea', 'vanilla-bean'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '2 fl oz', 'cream-heavy'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '8 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'lemon': ['lemon', '1 ea', 'lemon'], 'oranges': ['oranges', '2 ea', 'oranges'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'lime': ['lime', '1 ea', 'lime']}
fields.directions: 1 Squeeze the juice from the oranges, lemon and lime. In a medium saucepot, combine the cit-rus juices with the vanilla bean. Bring to a simmer and reduce by two-thirds. Add the cream to the mixture and reduce by two-thirds. Lower the heat and slowly whisk in the butter to form a beurre blanc sauce. Season with salt, strain the sauce and reserve in a warm place.

fields.name: Onions Brls
fields.ingredient_amount: {'onion-spanish': ['Spanish onion', '6 ea', 'onion-spanish']}
fields.directions: To prepare an onion brl, peel the onion, trim off the root end and cut it in half. Place the onion halves cut sides down in a dry skillet over medium-high heat. Cook until the onion halves char and darken. The oignon brl is then simmered in stocks or soups to give them a clear caramel color.

fields.name: Onion Piquet
fields.ingredient_amount: {'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '1 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'onion-spanish': ['Spanish onion', '1 ea', 'onion-spanish'], 'cloves-whole': ['whole cloves', '4 ea', 'cloves-whole']}
fields.directions: Peel onion and trim off root end. Spliit in half. Attach bay leaves using cloves as pins.

fields.name: Savory Crepes
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '14 oz', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '6 ea', 'eggs'], 'water': ['water', '12 fl oz', 'water'], 'egg-yolks': ['egg yolks', '6 ea', 'egg-yolks'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '5 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'milk': ['milk', '18 fl oz', 'milk'], 'clarified-butter': ['Clarified Butteras needed', '', 'clarified-butter'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tsp', 'salt'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1 tbl', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Whisk together the eggs, egg yolks, water and milk. Add the sugar, salt and flour; whisk to-gether. Stir in the melted butter. Cover and set aside to rest for at least 1 hour before cooking. Heat a small saut or crpe pan; brush lightly with clarified butter. Pour in 1 to 1 1/2 fluid ounces (30 to 45 milliliters) of batter; swirl to coat the bottom of the pan evenly. Cook the crpe until set and light brown, approximately 30 seconds. Flip it over and cook a few seconds longer. Remove from the pan. Repeat this process until all the batter is used. Cooked crpes may be used immediately or covered and held briefly in a warm oven. Crpes can also be wrapped well in plastic wrap and refrigerated for 2 to 3 days or frozen for several weeks. Note: May Substitute up to 5 ounces (150 grams) buckwheat flour or whole-wheat flour for an equal amount of the all-purpose flour.

fields.name: Berry Compote
fields.ingredient_amount: {'ice-cream-vanilla': ['vanilla ice creamas needed', '', 'ice-cream-vanilla'], 'brandy': ['brandy', '3 tbl', 'brandy'], 'raspberries': ['raspberries', '1/2 cup', 'raspberries'], 'strawberries': ['strawberries', '1/2 cup', 'strawberries'], 'american-pound-cake': ['American Pound Cakeas needed', '', 'american-pound-cake'], 'honey': ['honey', '3 fl oz', 'honey'], 'blackberries': ['blackberries', '1/2 cup', 'blackberries'], 'oranges': ['oranges', '2 ea', 'oranges'], 'cinnamon-stick': ['cinnamon stick', '1 ea', 'cinnamon-stick'], 'blueberries': ['blueberries', '1/2 cup', 'blueberries'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '4 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Select an assortment of fresh or frozen berriesstrawberries, blueberries, raspberries, black-berries and cherries can be used, depending on availability. Place the fruits and sugar in a nonreactive saucepan. Finely grate the zest from one orange and set aside. Add the juice from the two oranges to the saucepan. Bring to a simmer over low heat; cook until the fruits are soft but still intact. Strain the mixture, saving both the fruits and the liquid. Return the liquid to the saucepan. Add the finely grated zest from one orange and the honey, cinnamon and brandy. Bring to a boil and reduce until the mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon. Re-move from the heat and cool to room temperature. Remove the cinnamon stick. Gently stir the reserved fruits into the sauce, cover and chill. Serve with ice cream or poundcake.

fields.name: Dijon Vinaigrette
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'mustard-dijon': ['Dijon mustard', '4 fl oz', 'mustard-dijon'], 'salt': ['salt', '2 tsp', 'salt'], 'oil-vegetable': ['vegetable oil', '24 fl oz', 'oil-vegetable'], 'vinegar-wine': ['wine vinegar', '8 fl oz', 'vinegar-wine']}
fields.directions: Add 4 ounces (120 grams) Dijon-style mustard to the vinegar and proceed with the recipe.

fields.name: Plum Tomato Concass
fields.ingredient_amount: {'tomatoes-plum': ['plum tomatoes', '11 ea', 'tomatoes-plum']}
fields.directions: With a paring knife, mark an x on the bottom of the tomato just deep enough to penetrate the skin. Blanch the tomato in boiling water for 20 seconds,refresh in ice water. Using a paring knife, cut out the core and peel the tomato. Cut the tomato in half horizontally and squeeze out the seeds and juice. Chop or dice the tomato as desired for the recipe.

fields.name: Green Curry Paste
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lemongrass': ['lemongrass', '4 tbl', 'lemongrass'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '4 tbl', 'shallot'], 'garlic-clove': ['garlic clove', '8 ea', 'garlic-clove'], 'galangal-fresh': ['fresh galangal', '5 slice', 'galangal-fresh'], 'cumin-ground': ['ground cumin', '1 tsp', 'cumin-ground'], 'pepper-thai-chile': ['Thai chile pepper', '5 ea', 'pepper-thai-chile'], 'shrimp-paste-dried': ['dried shrimp paste', '1 tsp', 'shrimp-paste-dried'], 'cilantro-fresh': ['fresh cilantro', '1/2 oz', 'cilantro-fresh'], 'pepper-jalapeno-chile': ['jalapeno chile pepper', '10 ea', 'pepper-jalapeno-chile']}
fields.directions: 1 Combine all the ingredients in a blender and process until smooth.

fields.name: Gazpacho
fields.ingredient_amount: {'onion': ['onion', '8 oz', 'onion'], 'tomato-juice': ['tomato juice', '3 qt', 'tomato-juice'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '4 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '2 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'vinegar-red-wine': ['red wine vinegar', '2 fl oz', 'vinegar-red-wine'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'cucumber': ['cucumber', '3 oz', 'cucumber'], 'onion-green': ['green onion', '2 oz', 'onion-green'], 'pepper-green-bell': ['green bell pepper', '4 oz', 'pepper-green-bell'], 'pepper-yellow-bell': ['yellow bell pepper', '4 oz', 'pepper-yellow-bell'], 'garlic': ['garlic', '1 oz', 'garlic'], 'white-stock': ['White Stockas needed', '', 'white-stock'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'pepper-red-bell': ['red bell pepper', '4 oz', 'pepper-red-bell'], 'basil-fresh': ['fresh basilas needed', '', 'basil-fresh'], 'fresh-bread-crumbs': ['Fresh Bread Crumbs', '3 oz', 'fresh-bread-crumbs'], 'tomatoes-fresh': ['fresh tomatoes', '8 oz', 'tomatoes-fresh'], 'pepper-cayenne': ['cayenne pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-cayenne']}
fields.directions: Combine and pure all ingredients except the tomato juice, stock and garnish in a VCM, food processor or blender. Stir in the tomato juice. Adjust the consistency with the stock. Stir in the vegetable garnishes and adjust the seasonings. Serve in chilled cups or bowls garnished with fresh basil. VARIATION: Gazpacho can be made without pureing all the ingredients. Less garnish will be required

fields.name: Raspberry Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'lemon-juice-fresh': ['Lemon Juice (fresh)', '1 fl oz', 'lemon-juice-fresh'], 'raspberries': ['raspberries', '2 lb', 'raspberries'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Pure the berries and strain through a fine chinois. Stir in the sugar and lemon juice. Adjust the flavor with additional sugar if necessary.

fields.name: Champagne Cream Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'wine-chardonnay': ['chardonnay wine', '8 fl oz', 'wine-chardonnay'], 'cream-sour': ['sour cream', '1 tbl', 'cream-sour'], 'onion-yellow': ['yellow onion', '3 oz', 'onion-yellow'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1/4 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'champagne': ['champagne', '8 fl oz', 'champagne'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '1 tsp', 'butter-unsalted'], 'crab-whole': ['whole crab', '1 lb', 'crab-whole'], 'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 qt', 'cream-heavy'], 'salt-kosher': ['kosher salt', '1 tsp', 'salt-kosher']}
fields.directions: Heat the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and bay leaves and saut until the onion is translucent, approximately 3 minutes. Add the wine, champagne and crab and reduce by half. Add the cream and reduce by half, or until the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Add the salt and pepper. Strain the sauce through a china cap, pressing well to remove all liquid from the shells, and then add the sour cream. Blend the sauce with a few pulses of an immersion blender just enough to froth the sauce. Keep warm for service.

fields.name: Chocolate Caramel Mousse
fields.ingredient_amount: {'cream-heavy': ['heavy cream', '1 1/2 qt', 'cream-heavy'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '7 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'chocolate-unsweetened': ['unsweetened chocolate', '6 oz', 'chocolate-unsweetened'], 'chocolate-extra-bitter': ['extra bitter chocolate', '13 oz', 'chocolate-extra-bitter'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '1, 5 lb', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: 1 Place the sugar in a large heavy saucepan. Add enough water to make a wet sand, approxi-mately 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters). Place the pan over medium-high heat. Cook the sugar to a caramel stage, periodically brushing down the sides of the pot with water to prevent any sugar crystals from building up. 2 Meanwhile, place the cream and butter in a small pot and bring to a boil. Set aside until need-ed. 3 Combine the chocolates in a large bowl. Set aside. 4 When the caramel reaches a dark brown color, remove from the heat and slowly add the cream-and-butter mixture. Be very careful of the boiling caramel because serious burns can result. When all of the cream has been added, strain the mixture over the bowl of chopped chocolates. Let the chocolate and cream rest for approximately 1 minute and then whisk to-gether until the chocolate is fully melted. 5 Set aside the chocolate ganache until cooled to room temperature. Once cooled, whisk in half of the whipped cream. Fold in the remaining cream. Use the mousse immediately.

fields.name: Pears Poached in Red Wine
fields.ingredient_amount: {'vanilla-bean': ['vanilla bean', '1 ea', 'vanilla-bean'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '9 ea', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'pear-anjou': ['anjou pear', '8 ea', 'pear-anjou'], 'wine-zinfandel': ['Zinfandel wine', '52 fl oz', 'wine-zinfandel'], 'orange-zest': ['Orange Zest', '1 1/2 tbl', 'orange-zest'], 'basil-fresh': ['fresh basil', '1 oz', 'basil-fresh'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '12 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Peel and core the pears, leaving the stems intact. Combine the remaining ingredients in a large nonreactive saucepan. Arrange the pears in the liquid in a single layer. Place the pears on the stove top over a medium-high flame. Bring to just below a boil, then immediately reduce the heat and allow the liquid to simmer gently. Cover with a round of parchment paper if necessary to keep the pears submerged. Continue poaching the pears until tender, approximately 1 to 112 hours. Remove the sauce-pan from the stove and allow the pears to cool in the liquid. Remove the pears from the poaching liquid and return the liquid to the stove top. Reduce un-til the liquid is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, then strain. Serve the pears chilled or at room temperature in a pool of the reduced wine syrup.

fields.name: Marchand de Vin Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper to taste', '', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'shallot': ['shallot', '2 oz', 'shallot'], 'wine-dry-red': ['dry red wine', '8 fl oz', 'wine-dry-red'], 'demi-glace': ['Demi-Glace', '1 qt', 'demi-glace'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt']}
fields.directions: Reduce 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) dry red wine and 2 ounces (60 grams) diced shallots by two-thirds. Then add demi-glace, simmer and strain. Season  to taste with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Apricot Sauce
fields.ingredient_amount: {'ginger-fresh': ['fresh ginger', '1 tbl', 'ginger-fresh'], 'vinegar-red-wine': ['red wine vinegar', '1/2 fl oz', 'vinegar-red-wine'], 'mustard-dry': ['dry mustard', '1 tsp', 'mustard-dry'], 'apricot-preserves': ['apricot preserves', '8 oz', 'apricot-preserves']}
fields.directions: Combine all ingredients and heat until the preserves melt and the flavors blend.

fields.name: Salisbury Steak
fields.ingredient_amount: {'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '7 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'marjoram-whole': ['whole marjoram', '5 tsp', 'marjoram-whole'], 'beef-ground': ['ground beef', '13, 4 lb', 'beef-ground'], 'mushroom-sauce': ['Mushroom Sauceas needed', '', 'mushroom-sauce'], 'milk': ['milk', '5 fl oz', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt to taste', '', 'salt'], 'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '5, 4 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'eggs': ['eggs', '7 ea', 'eggs'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1 1/2 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'worcestershire-sauce': ['worcestershire sauce', '4 tsp', 'worcestershire-sauce'], 'corn-flake-crumbs': ['corn flake crumbs', '10 1/2 oz', 'corn-flake-crumbs'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole']}
fields.directions: Saut the mirepoix in the oil until tender. Add the thyme, marjoram, pepper and salt. Remove from the pan, cool, and refrigerate until cold. Combine the mirepoix with the cornflake crumbs, eggs, Worcestershire sauce and milk and mix well. Add the beef, adjust the seasonings and mix well. Make a small patty and cook it. Taste it to check the seasonings and adjust them if necessary. Scale forty 5-ounce (150-gram) portions of the mixture. Alternatively, use a slightly rounded #8 scoop to portion the mixture. Form each portion into a flattened football-shaped patty and place on a baking sheet. Bake the Salisbury steaks at 325F (160C) until done, approximately 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with mushroom sauce.

fields.name: Country Biscuits
fields.ingredient_amount: {'flour-all-purpose': ['all purpose flour', '2, 8 lb', 'flour-all-purpose'], 'baking-powder': ['baking powder', '2 oz', 'baking-powder'], 'butter-unsalted': ['unsalted butter', '14 oz', 'butter-unsalted'], 'milk': ['milk', '24 fl oz', 'milk'], 'salt': ['salt', '3/4 oz', 'salt'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '2 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Sift the dry ingredients together, making sure they are blended thoroughly. Cut in the butter. The mixture should look mealy; do not overmix. Add the milk and stir, combining only until the mixture holds together. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface; knead until it forms one mass, approxi-mately five or six kneadings. Roll out the dough to a thickness of 12 inch (1.2 centimeters)

fields.name: Duck Stock
fields.ingredient_amount: {'mirepoix': ['Mirepoix', '2 lb', 'mirepoix'], 'water': ['water', '3 gal', 'water'], 'bay-leaves-dried': ['dried bay leaves', '2 ea', 'bay-leaves-dried'], 'pepper-whole-black': ['whole black pepper', '1/2 tsp', 'pepper-whole-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsley', '8 sprig', 'parsley-fresh'], 'duck-whole': ['whole duck', '10 lb', 'duck-whole'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1/2 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'duck-trimmings': ['duck trimmings', '5 lb', 'duck-trimmings']}
fields.directions: Cut the duck into 10 pieces. Take the breast meat off the frame and reserve for other use. Place duck and trimmings in a stockpot and cover with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.

fields.name: Pork Scallops (3 oz)
fields.ingredient_amount: {'pork-loin-boneless': ['boneless pork loin', '1 ea', 'pork-loin-boneless']}
fields.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim pork loin of any fat or silverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 3 oz scallops. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.

fields.name: Chocolate Cutouts
fields.ingredient_amount: {'chocolate-bittersweet': ['bittersweet chocolate', '1 lb', 'chocolate-bittersweet']}
fields.directions: Melt and temper chocolate. Spread on marble and using sharp knife,or cutters, cut out desire shapes

fields.name: Roasted Vegetable Soup
fields.ingredient_amount: {'tomatoes-plum': ['plum tomatoes', '8 oz', 'tomatoes-plum'], 'baguette': ['baguetteas needed', '', 'baguette'], 'pepper-green-bell': ['green bell pepper', '6 oz', 'pepper-green-bell'], 'oil-olive': ['olive oil', '4 fl oz', 'oil-olive'], 'roasted-garlic-pura-e': ['Roasted Garlic PurÃ©e', '2 oz', 'roasted-garlic-pura-e'], 'salt': ['salt', '1 tbl', 'salt'], 'squash-yellow': ['yellow squash', '1 lb', 'squash-yellow'], 'onion': ['onion', '1 lb', 'onion'], 'chicken-stock': ['Chicken Stock', '2 qt', 'chicken-stock'], 'zucchini': ['zucchini', '1 lb', 'zucchini'], 'pepper-ground-black': ['ground black pepper', '1 tsp', 'pepper-ground-black'], 'parsley-fresh': ['fresh parsleyas needed', '', 'parsley-fresh'], 'pepper-red-bell': ['red bell pepper', '6 oz', 'pepper-red-bell'], 'thyme-dried-whole': ['dried whole thyme', '1 tsp', 'thyme-dried-whole'], 'asparagus-medium': ['medium asparagus', '8 oz', 'asparagus-medium'], 'pepper-yellow-bell': ['yellow bell pepper', '6 oz', 'pepper-yellow-bell']}
fields.directions: Combine the chopped vegetables with the oil, salt, pepper and thyme. Toss to coat the vege-tables evenly with the oil and seasonings. Spread the vegetables on a sheet pan and roast in a 450F (230C) oven until they are well browned. Remove the vegetables from the oven and place them in a saucepot. Add the stock and roasted garlic pure. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook until all of the vegetables are very tender, approximately 30 minutes. Pure the soup in batches in a blender or food processor. Strain through a coarse china cap or pass through a food mill. Season  to taste with salt and pepper. Serve the soup garnished with chopped parsley and toasted baguette slices.

fields.name: Italian Meringue
fields.ingredient_amount: {'water': ['water', '3 fl oz', 'water'], 'corn-syrup-light': ['light corn syrup', '2 oz', 'corn-syrup-light'], 'egg-whites': ['egg whites', '8 oz', 'egg-whites'], 'sugar-granulated': ['granulated sugar', '13 oz', 'sugar-granulated']}
fields.directions: Place 12 ounces (360 grams) sugar in a heavy saucepan with the corn syrup and water. Attach a candy thermometer to the pan and bring the sugar to a boil over high heat. Place the egg whites in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whip attachment. As the temperature of the boiling sugar approaches 220F (104C), begin whipping the egg whites. When the whites form soft peaks, gradually add the remaining 1 ounces (30 grams) sugar. Lower the mixer speed and continue whipping. When the sugar reaches the soft ball stage (240F/116C), remove it from the heat. Pour it into the whites, with the mixer running at high speed. Pour in a steady stream between the side of the bowl and the beater. Once all the sugar is incorporated, whip 1 more minute at high speed, then reduce to medium speed and whip until the meringue is cool.
